loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Justin requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Marivic requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle for her business.  In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy a bicycle

loans.name: Scarlet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Scarlet works hard to support her family.  She has a video gaming machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Scarlet is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her video gaming machine for her video gaming machine rental business.

Scarlet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy spare parts for video game machine

loans.name: Everlina

texts.en:
Everlina is 37 years old and married with two children.   Everlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Everlina requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cooking oil, soft-drinks, beers, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.  She has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan.   

Everlina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell for her gasoline retailing business.

Julita has been in this business for 5 years.  She also earns more income from a general store.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy gasoline containers

loans.name: Tito Alberto

texts.es: Don Tito de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una sastrería desde hace 14 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Tito, 57, lives in his own house with his wife. He has owned a tailor shop for the past 14 years. He has his sewing shop located in his place of residence and he has many customers because of the quality with which he performs on the clothing. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc. and therefore be able to continue with his work, which generates good income for him.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es: la sra. martha  de 54   años  soltera  y con 2 hijos , martha se dedica ya hace 19  años a la venta  de comida(desayuno y cena)en un pequeño  mercado  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y tener un ingreso mas,Con el fruto de su esfuerzo martha  ha logrado mejorar su  vivienda y también  Seguir mejorando en su  negocio,Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más sillas, mesas  etc.  y así  poder ampliar su local y poder tener más ingresos. martha  se encuentra sentada se le distingue por su casaca de color crema , A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso
texts.en:
Martha is 54 years old and single with two children. For the past 19 years, she has made a living by selling meals daily (breakfast and dinner) at a small market with the intent of making progress and increasing her income. Through the results of her efforts, Martha has managed to improve her home while also continuing to improve her business. She will invest the requested loan amount on purchasing chairs, tables, etc. and thus be able to expand her business and increase her earnings. 

Martha is shown in this picture seated and wearing a beige jacket. She bids farewell to Kiva and EDAPROSPO with a hug and thanks them for their previous loans, which have made her progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, etc. and thus be able to expand her business

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak is a musician with 25 years of experience. The attendance of special events (birthday parties, wedding, etc.) provides Spartak with the only income for his family. He plays different musical instruments and is very talented. 

He has now applied for this loan to be able to pay for renovation of musical instruments and to purchase speakers for providing musical service.  His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of musical instruments and to purchase speakers for providing musical service.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 50 years old and lives in Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Concepcion has a hectare of rice fields and has been doing this farming activity for 6 years. She is the assistant farmer of her husband. She has requested a loan to buy 4 sacks of fertilizers and inputs to make her rice healthy growing and away from insects for more harvest. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

In the future, Concepcion hopes that through her farming activity, her children can finish their studies and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of fertilizers and inputs

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 59 years old and lives in Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a small store in the market area and has had this business for 5 years.

Demetria has requested a loan to purchase more goods for her store and ingredients for her snack vending business to earn more for her family. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Demetria wants to engage in another business to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store and ingredients for her snack vending

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano de 39 años soltero con una familia que mantener se a decidido realizar otro segundo préstamo porque la demanda de ejote a crecido en estos últimos mésese es por ello que el quiere aprovechar estas oportunidades que se les están presentando en la vida, para poder sembrar mas ejotes en sus terrenos disponibles y también para que le generan más ganancias para el y para el beneficio de su familia.

Cuando el no tenía acceso a préstamos las condiciones de vida no eran adecuadas no producía casi nada de ejotes pero todo eso cambio porque  ahora cuanta con mas siembras de ejotes y las ganancias son mejores como antes y eso a podido cambiar un poco en las condiciones de vida.

La inversión que el realizara para el nuevo préstamo es para la compra de semilla de ejotes y abono orgánico  para luego sembrarlas en sus terrenos disponibles, los cambios que los préstamos a podido realizar en la vida de Mariano son muy importantes porque en la actualidad tiene más siembras de ejotes.

Las metas de el es la construcción de su propia casa para tener condicione de vidas adecuadas en conjunto con su familia y darles educación a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Mariano, 39,  single with a family to maintain, has dedicated himself to carrying out another second loan because the demand for corn has grown in these last months. It's for this that he wants to take advantage of these opportunities that are presenting themselves in life: to be able to plant more corn on his available land and also so that it will generate more income for him and for the benefit of his family.

When he didn't have access to loans, living conditions weren't adequate. He produced almost no corn but all of this changed because now he has more corn planted and the income is better than before; this has been able to change the living conditions a little.

He will carry out the investment for the new loan for the purchase of corn seed and organic fertilizer to plant them later on his available land. The changes that the loans have been able to make in Mariano's life are very important because currently he has more corn plants.

His goals are the construction of his own house to have adequate living conditions along with his family and give education to his children so that they become professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es: Miriam nació en la comunidad de El Sardinal en el año 1980, en una familia muy pobre. Miriam asistía a la escuela de su comunidad pero solo pudo llegar hasta segundo grado de primaria, despues de eso empezó a aprender las labores de la casa con su madre que le enseñó a lavar, cocinar y limpiar. Cuando tenía 20 años conoció a su novio Jairo, con quien vivió 10 años y procrearon tres hijos. Actualmente Miriam vive con sus padres y sus tres hijos, donde con ellos siembra granos básicos y café lo que representa su fuente de ingresos. En la comunidad donde viven, no existe la energía eléctrica es por eso que Miriam necesita adquirir un pequeño sistema solar para poder obtener iluminación y cargar su celular para poder comunicarse; de esta manera ella y su familia tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam was born into a very poor family in the community of El Sardinal in 1980. She attended the school in her community, but she was able to study only up to the second grade in primary school. After that, she began to learn household chores with her mother, who taught her to wash, cook and clean. When she was twenty, Miriam met her boyfriend Jairo, with whom she lived for ten years and had three children.

Today, Miram lives with her parents and her three children.  They grow basic grains and coffee, which represent the source of the family’s income. In the community where they live, there is no electicity and for this reason Miraim needs to acquire a small solar system to be able to have lighting and to charge her cell phone in order to be able communicate. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a small solar system.

loans.name: Sokkien

texts.en:
Sokkien, 24 years old, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one dependent child. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. She has been involved in this career since 2000. On average, she can make an income of USD 5 per day.

Sokkien applied for a KIVA loan via HKL and she is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. With the support from this loan, she hopes it can help to promote her living standard. She would like to thank to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ngini

texts.en:
Farming, also called agriculture or husbandry, is the cultivation of animals and plants for food and other products used to sustain life. Agriculture in Kenya continues to dominate Kenya’s economy, and is also the largest contributor to Kenya’s gross domestic product.

Ngini, 35, started farming approximately six years ago, and although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His half-acre of land located in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, houses poultry and dairy cows. He is a very hard-working, passionate and dedicated small-scale farmer. He is happily married, and together with his beautiful wife, are blessed with two children. 

For the past six years he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. He sells milk and farm produce to his neighbors and to the local market but has been facing one big problem and that is timely delivery of the products to the market. He is seeking a loan to buy another motorbike that would solve his transportation problem. 

Kerugoya is located in a very remote area that has a poor road network and the terrain is very bad. The only mode of transport is Boda Boda (motorbike).This loan will be of great help because it will allow Ngini to transport his farm products to the market and deliver them in a timely manner. Milk and vegetables are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch high prices. Through the loan, Ngini will not be worried because he will always deliver the products on time and gain more profits. This motorbike will be reliable for quick transportation for both long and short distances. Through the motorbike, Ngini's life is going to change and his standards of living are going to improve.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, soft-drinks, etc., to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, soft-drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the rest of the semester fees.

loans.name: Qeblah

texts.en: Qeblah is a 52-year-old widow, who is supporting a family of five. After her husband passed away she started getting an after death retirement salary, but that was not enough. She later started a small retail business at home selling blankets, bed covers, and home products. Now Qebla is asking for a loan to increase her next order of kitchen products to get it at a good price.

loans.use: to increase her next order of kitchen products to get it at a good price.

loans.name: Marleth Eugenia

texts.es: MARLETH EUGENIA: Es una señora alegre y amable, originaria  de Waspam, casada con 4 hijos: 2 mayores de edad e independientes, la de  18 años cursaba su segundo año de carrera universitaria, sin embargo este año no pudo continuar por problemas económicos y la menor de 14 años, estudia su segundo año de secundaria (aparece en la fotografía con su mama).  Su esposo es conductor de motor fuera de borda. Desde hace 14 años habita en una vivienda de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de concreto solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales: cemento, bloques, hierro, arena y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir el muro perimetral de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marleth Eugenia is a joyful and kind woman native to Waspam. She is married and has four children: two who are of age and independent, an 18 year old, and a 14 year old. The 18 year old was enrolled in her second year of university up until this year, when she was unable to continue for financial reasons. The youngest, the 14 year old, is enrolled in her second year of secondary school and appears in the picture with her mother. Marleth's husband drives an outboard-motor boat for a living. 

They have lived in a wooden house built on stilts for 14 years. In order to build a concrete house, they are requesting a loan to buy materials (cement, blocks, iron, sand) and cover labor costs. Her dream is to build a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.use: to build a house made of concrete.

loans.name: Induleta

texts.en:
Induleta lives in Dili. She is married and has 6 children. There are 8 members in her family, including her 6 children and her husband. She has been doing business since March 2014 with her own working capital of $800.00.

She wants to increase her business, so she is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital, to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, such as soaps, lighters, cigarettes, candies, cooking oils, biscuits, scissors, slippers and other things to sell.

She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps, lighters, cigarettes, candies, cooking oils, biscuits, scissors, slippers and other things to sell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt:
A senhora Matilde  de 45 anos de idade e solteira mae de 4 filhos dos quais 1 ja e independente vive em casa propria,2 frequentam o ensino secundario e 1 o ensino primario. 
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia grossa,porta, pedra, chapas de zinco, ferros, para dar continuidade  a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro quer ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia aumentar dependencias para aumentar a renda familiar.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos e que tem recorrido tambem a xitiques familiares para suprir algumas dificuldades.
texts.en: Matilde is a 45-year-old single mother to 4 children: 1 of whom is already grown up and lives away from the family home, 2 more attend secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. She says that with this loan, she will buy building sand, doors, stone, zinc sheeting and iron rods which will allow her to continue with building work on her home. Her aims for the future are to extend her house to enable her to have a more comfortable family home and to build outbuildings to enable her to increase her family income. She says that she is committed to repaying her loan in a punctual manner and she intends to apply for further loans to allow her to achieve her dreams. She has also previously overcome her financial difficulties by being part of a family xitique savings initiative.

loans.use: to buy building sand, doors, stone, zinc sheeting and iron rods

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a fifty-two-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is a mother of a fourteen-year-old child. 

Wilma  is a busy woman operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells assorted goods ranging from eggs, spices, coffee, sugar, noodles and canned goods.  She has been  in this kind of business for ten years now.  Wilma is also engaged in a food vending business. She makes and sells snack food as additional source of income. 

Wilma  has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted stocks for her store, and additional piglets and pig feed. Wilma dream of raising hogs as supplemental income that would help pay the expenses for her family.

Wilma hopes to have a stable income that would help her send her child to college education.

loans.use: restock her store & buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, who is 27 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has one dependent child. To make a living and support his family, he has been involved with a rice farming business on a small farm since 2000. On average, he makes USD 5.00 per day.

For supplementary income, Sorn wants to raise cows and sell them once they are big enough. He is applying for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy the cows. With support from this loan, Sorn hopes to improve his living standard. He would like to thank to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 48-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She operates a small sari-sari or variety store business at her place. For more than two years now, Jocelyn made a living from her store.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more rice, canned goods, shampoos, toiletries, condiments, biscuits and snack foods to sell.  This will enable her to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Jocelyn hopes of making her business stable and productive.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is standing next to her stocks of crab traps. These traps that look like baskets are used in catching crabs, which is Marlyn's business. 

Marlyn started her fishing business together with her husband a long time ago. This livelihood has been instrumental in raising her four children, now aged  4 to 23. She is asking for a loan to buy 650 pcs. of crab traps and two types of ropes. This will make it easier for them to catch more and earn a better income for their family. 

In the future, Marlyn hopes to make her business a success and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: buy crab traps and rope

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
En la salida de la localidad donde se encuentra el grupo Las Orquídeas hay un pozo de chapopote inactivo y las ruinas de una calera. La siembra de caña de azúcar, el trabajo en campo, y los pequeños negocios son lo que le dan vida a la localidad. Las integrantes que día a día trabajan en su negocio y por sus familias son: 

Gloria - Venta De Lencería
Alma -Venta De Cosméticos
Cynthia - Servicio De Ciber
Eusebia - Venta De Los Antojitos
Martin – Servicio  De Papelería
Yazmin -Venta De Fertilizantes
María -Venta De Antojitos 

Eusebia es una señora de carácter fuerte, pero también muy amable. Es madre soltera de tres hijos, por lo que hace tiempo inició con la venta de antojitos pues necesitaba solventar los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus pequeños. Al principio vendía en su casa debajo de un gran árbol de mango donde ponía una lona y acomodaba dos mesas. Pronto, las vecinas también comenzaron a vender comida y fue como decidió salir a vender de manera ambulante en una carretilla a pesar de que era un poco incómodo, mas sus hijos le daban fuerzas en todo momento para salir adelante aquellas veces que pensaba que el negocio no funcionaria. Hoy en día vende en la escuela primaria y lo hace en un triciclo el cual acondicionó para poder transportar los antojitos. Su labor inicia a las 7 de la mañana preparando la comida, para la cual utiliza leña pues le da un mejor sabor a lo que prepara. Después, acomoda todo en el triciclo junto con algunos botes de dulces que también a comenzado a vender, se encomienda a Dios y emprende su camino a la escuela primaria para estar 10 minutos antes de que inicie el receso. Además, en temporada de corte de caña, tiene nueve clientes a quienes les prepara el almuerzo diario.

Eusebia necesita un préstamo para comprar carne, crema, maíz, queso, llantas nuevas al triciclo y una sombrilla grande para protegerse del sol y del agua. De esta manera podrá continuar con la actividad que le permite proveer a su hija que aún vive con ella y continúa estudiando. “Lo he decidido: nuevamente venderé antojitos en mi casa los fines de semana” comenta decidida.

*En la imagen: doña Eusebia viste una blusa de tirantes.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of the small town where Las Orquídeas [The Orchids] live there is an inactive tar pit and the ruins of a quarry.
Sowing sugar cane, agricultural work and the small businesses are what give life to the village. The group members who work day after day in their businesses for their families are:

Gloria - Undergarment Sales
Alma - Cosmetics Sales
Cynthia - Cyber Service
Eusebia - Finger Food Sales
Martin – Stationary Sales
Yazmin - Fertilizer Sales
María - Finger Food Sales

Eusebia is a strong but kind woman. She is a single mother of three children and therefore started her finger food sales awhile ago as she needed to meet household expenses and pay for her children's education. Starting off she sold from her house by putting a tarpaulin and two tables under a large mango tree. Soon her neighbors also began selling food and therefore she decided to continue her sales on the streets with a pushcart even though this was less comfortable for her. Her children gave her strength to continue ahead whenever she felt that the business would not work out.

Nowadays she sells at the elementary school using a tricycle that she fixed up to transport the food. She starts her working day at 7am by preparing the food for which she uses wood as it provides the food with a better taste. Afterwards she accommodates everything on her tricycle together with sweets that she has also begun selling. She then commends herself to God and makes her way to the school so that she gets there 10 minutes ahead of the break. Also, during sugar cane harvesting season she has new clients that she provides with their daily lunch.

Eusebia needs the loan to buy meat, cream, corn, cheese, new tires for her tricycle and a large umbrella to protect herself from the sun and the rain. This will enable her to continue with her business which provides for her daughter that still lives with her and studies at school. "I have decided that I will now also sell finger food from my home on the weekends" she comments decidedly.

*Eusebia is wearing a tank top in the photo.

loans.use: to buy meat, cream, corn, cheese, new tricycle tires and an umbrella.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia. She sends you her gratitude for your generosity because her previous loan had enhanced her business. She was able to buy more gift items needed in her shop. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Celia is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional stocks of toys and other items of the like that she needs to increase her product inventory. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if she maintains a good income from her business.

Celia hopes to expand her gift shop so she can house more items to sell.  She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restock her gift shop

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora sends you her gratitude for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products which are needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children who are already in college.

Rhodora is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will lend her 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Rhodora aims to give her children good education. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Lenders, the above picture presents to you Henry, a very hardworking and very ambitious go-getter who is 24 years of age.  He hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a rural town on the slopes of the famous Mount Kenya. He is married and together with his wife they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Through all those years he has been able to take care of his family and pay school fees for his school-going child. 

Although this humble man has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses" - Henry has been facing financial challenges.  Because the Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, Henry is seeking a loan to buy cereals to improve his income level. 

Henry's upbringing was challenging and he has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling man has been making great improvements and he believes that through your loan he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo Henry has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances and he hopes that through profits from his business he will fully pay back the loan. Henry is very visionary and hopes through the accumulated profits he will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost his income and completely turn his life around.

loans.use: buy cereal grains

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
This is Carlos. He sends you his gratitude for your generosity because his previous loan had enhanced his business. He was able to buy spare parts and accessories for his vehicle. The loan also helped him provide for his family's daily needs and expenditures.

Carlos is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will let him borrow again an amount of 16,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for his tricycle. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family if the vehicle is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Carlos desires to buy another tricycle so he could generate more income. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy a tricycle

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Mandzaano and they have created a strong circle of support with each other. In each weekly meeting, they emphasize the confidence, accountability and adherence to training that they have been receiving from ID-Ghana. Their goal is to continue together for many more loan cycles and maintain an excellent credit record. In addition, they are gaining a lot of useful knowledge each week with the ID-Ghana Loan Officer who presents various educational training sessions on relevant and useful themes like financial management, nutrition and health. It is the combination of the loans and education that makes the Micro credit Program of ID-Ghana so useful to Mandzaan group members. 

Comfort has been selling slippers, underwear, chicken cooking oil and charcoal for 4 years. She is 50 years old, married and has children. She lives with her family in their family home in Teshie. She needs this loan to buy slippers, underwear, chicken cooking oil and charcoal to sell to her customers. The other members of her group are: Emmanuel, who sells fishing equipment; Rebecca, who sells smoke fish; Cynthia, who sells smoke fish; and Esther, who sells cooking utensils. They will need a total amount of 5600 GHS to better their businesses. Each one is responsible for one another's repayment of the loan (group pressure). They want to share that they are very grateful to Kiva investors for believing in them and funding their loans.

loans.use: to buy slippers, underwear, oil, charcoal

loans.name: Ofik

texts.en:
Ofik lives in Kapan town with her husband and two children (ages 5 and 4 years old).  A hairdresser by profession, years ago Ofik opened her own beauty salon where she also works as a hairdresser. Her husband assists her a lot with the administrative work connected with the salon. They both are very enthusiastic about running the beauty salon in an effective and profitable way. 

To be able to pay for the renovation of the salon Ofik has now applied for this loan. It has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: buy furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: Kakada

texts.en:
Kakada (shown in the picture) is 21 years old, single, and lives with his family in the Chba Ampov district, about 3 kilometers from MAXIMA, in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Kakada is a university student who is in year 3, semester 1, majoring in electricity. While he studies, he works as an electrician and has 2 years of experience. He said that because the salary he gets now is very small, he needs more money to be able to pay the school. He would like to apply for a loan to pay for his tutor fees. 

Kakada hopes that after he finishes at university, he can get a better salary in the future and can support his family.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her abaca weaving business.

Rosa has been in this business for 15 years. Rosa earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Vivencia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, margarine, yeast, sugar, butter, etc. for her business.

Vivencia has been in this business for eight years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, margarine, yeast, sugar, butter, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lucrencia

texts.pt:
A senhora Lucrencia de 52 anos de idade e viuva comerciante mae de 6 filhos dos quais 2 ja sao independentes vivem em casa propria, 3 ainda na sua responsabilidade 1 a frequentar o ensino primario e 2 o ensino secundario.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas  de zinco, barrotes, pedra, areia, portas para dar continuidade  a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro quer ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia, crescer no negocio construindo um aviario para criar e vender frangos.
 Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos e que tem recorido tambem a xitiques familiares para suprir algumas dificuldades
texts.en: Lucrencia is a 52-year-old widowed businesswoman and a mother to 6 children: 2 of whom are grown up and live independently, 3 more are still at home, with 1 attending primary school and 2 attending high school. She says that with this loan, she will buy sand, stone, zinc sheeting, beams and doors to continue with building work on her home. Her aims for the future are to extend her house to provide a more comfortable home for her family and to grow her business by building an aviary where she can raise and sell chickens. She says that she is committed to repaying her loan punctually and she plans to apply for further loans in order to achieve her dreams. She also relies on the support of a family xitique savings initiative to provide for her in times of difficulties.

loans.use: to buy sand, stone, zinc sheeting, beams and doors.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Sam Ath (in picture) is 26 years old, single, and lives with his family at Chroy Changva district along the Mekong River, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Sam Ath is a student who is studying at Norton University, year four, semester one, with a major in construction engineering. Nowadays, he works for CCPC as Assistant Observer and has one year of experience. 

He would like to apply for a loan to pay for his tutor fees.
 
Sam Ath hopes that after he finishes at university, he can get a better salary in the future and can support his family.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like powdered milk, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, chips, soap and seasonings.  She has been engaged in this business for 10 years now. She is 63 years old and has six  grown children. She lives with her family in Dulag, Leyte. Lucina has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy assorted goods like soft drinks, beverages, noodles and canned goods.  These are very helpful in attracting more customers while increasing her income.

Lucina hopes to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood and set aside some savings to prepare for retirement..

loans.use: to buy assorted goods  like soft drinks, beverages, noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Vic Bryan

texts.en:
Vic Bryan is very grateful for the loan assistance that enabled him to purchase quantities of raw materials, particularly Capiz shells, needed for his business. His earnings were a big help toward meeting his personal, household and business expenses.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed for his business. His profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his family’s daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Vic Bryan dreams of giving his family a good life and he wants to hire more workers who specialize in handicrafts. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 34-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is the mother of a 13-year-old child. 

She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. For the past ten years now, this business has provided her the income that she needs. 

Marites would like to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as soft drinks, noodles and canned goods, soap and toiletries, condiments and snack foods. This loan will allow her to augment her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Marites hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as soft drinks, noodles and canned goods, soap and toiletries, condiments and snack foods.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Jose de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al reciclaje de tarimas de madera asi como muestra la fotografía desde hace 2 años, y las vende a las empresa que compran maderas, ya tiene clientes fijos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar por mayor una tarimas que le vende a bajo precio y asi poder empezar a venderlas a sus clientes para obtener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 55-year-old Jose lives in his own house with his wife. He has made a living for the past two years by recycling wooden platforms, as shown in the photograph. He sells them to businesses that buy wood. He already has regular clients. He manages to get ahead in life with what he obtains from his sales. He is requesting a loan in order to buy some platforms wholesale, which he will sell at low prices. This will mean he will be able to begin selling them to his clients so he can obtain better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wooden platforms wholesale

loans.name: Malin

texts.en:
Malin is 19 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Dong Kor district near International Phnom Penh Airport, Cambodia.
Malin is a second-year, first-semester student at Vanda Institute in the field of accounting. She also works as an English teacher at a private school. She wants to apply for a loan to pay her school fees at university.
She is committed to earn money to support herself and repay the MAXIMA loan.
In the future, she wants to run her own business at her house.

loans.use: To pay her school fees.

loans.name: Asaf Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Asaf” está conformado por un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras y responsables, viven en un lugar muy tranquilo y pequeño, la mayoria de los habitantes son comerciantes: tienen un local pequeño o salen a otras comunidades para poder vender sus productos. Los integrantes explican que el nombre de su grupo lo eligieron ya que Asaf significa Unidos y ellos siempre se han apoyado, nunca ha surgido un problema entre ellos y menos en relación con sus pagos.

Emma es una persona muy alegre, una mujer muy positiva. Tiene 40 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Leonardo desde hace 24, tienen un hijo, pero ya es independiente.

Emma y su esposo son comerciantes desde hace ya varios años (20 y 25 exactamente). Se dedican a vender productos de temporada y esta vez están solicitando un préstamo para comprar almohadas. "Es un producto que se vende muy bien en estas épocas de frío porque la almohada es calientita", por ello Emma está muy interesada en recibir su préstamo, pues dentro de algunos días quieren salir de viaje para vender en otros estados. La pareja siempre sale por periodos de 20 días aproximadamente. Además, Emma vende otros productos como hilos, cordones y refacciones de licuadoras. Explica que su gusto por vender surgió gracias a su suegra pues ella también se dedicaba al comercio y la acompañó en muchas ocasiones lo que le dejó diversas enseñanzas. Al principio no fue fácil, pero con el tiempo y los años de experiencia Emma logró posicionarse con sus clientes. Ya hace 5 años que ella comenzó a solicitar créditos a VisionFund y comenta que han sido de gran apoyo, antes no contaba con el dinero para mejorar su negocio; con dificultad compraba su mercancía y ahora puede aprovechar para comprar al mayoreo y con un precio más bajo. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Raquel quien invertirá en bonetería y mercería; Felisa, en vasos de licuadora y mercería; Angélica en controles y vasos de licuadoras; Norma y Agustina, en jarceria y Juana, en fundas de plástico.
texts.en:
The “Asaf” group consists of a group of hard-working and responsible women. They live in a very peaceful and small place. The majority of its inhabitants are traders; they have a small stall or travel to other communities in order to sell their products. The members of the group have explained that they chose the name of their group because “Asaf” means “United” and they have always helped one another. They have never had a problem with each other, especially regarding money and payments.

Emma is a very happy person. She is a very positive woman. She is 40 years old and has been married to Leonardo for 24 years. They have a son, but he is already independent.

Emma and her husband have been in business for several years (20 and 25 years, to be exact). They sell seasonal products. They are requesting a loan to purchase pillows. “It is a product that sells very well in the cold season because the pillows are warm.” For this reason, Emma is very interested in receiving her loan as they want to leave in a few days to go and sell their products in other states. They always go away for periods of approximately 20 days. Emma also sells other products like threads, cords, and spare parts for blenders. She explains that her passion for sales comes from her mother-in-law as she also had a business and accompanied her on many occasions and taught her many things. At the beginning it wasn’t easy, but over time and after years of experience Emma managed to establish herself with her clients. She began requesting loans from VisionFund five years ago. She says they have been very helpful. She previously did not have the money to improve her business and she bought her merchandise with great difficulty, but now she can make the most of buying wholesale and at a lower price. 

The other members of the group are: Raquel, who will invest in haberdashery; Felisa, who will invest in blender jars and haberdashery; Angelica, who will invest in blender control units and blender jars; Norma and Agustina, who will invest in cleaning products; and Juana, who will invest in plastic sheet protectors.

loans.use: to buy pillows

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Hello lenders! Moses lives with his beautiful wife in Kapsowar, a small rural town in Kenya. The Kapsowar area is also referred to as the mango region of Kenya because half the mangoes consumed are from that region. He has been farming for the past five years and has never looked back. To earn a decent and honest living, he sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. Moses is satisfied with the returns he gets through farming. However, he wants to diversify and start horticulture farming. The main challenge he faces is accessing funds. He is kindly requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. To access funds, Moses joined Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports smallholder farmers with both financial and technical solutions. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo, he answered, “They assist small-scale farmers.” Through horticulture, he will be able to improve his living standards and secure the future of his school-going children. In the long run, the ultimate goal for Moses is to permanently improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, forty-six years old, is a married woman with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

She deals in cocoa buying and selling. She also has a cocoa garden to supplement her income. She looks after two grandchildren in addition to her five children. She hopes to become the biggest cocoa trader on Bundibugyo.

Christine intends to use the loan to buy more cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret used the previous loan to buy beer and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.  She is a hard-working married woman with three children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is still in retail and owns rentals. She faces challenges of customers not paying on time and price fluctuations. However, she hopes of expanding her business to new areas. Margret needs a loan to buy more beer and other general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beer and other general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a single mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Binti has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables, like wheat flour and maize flour, from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments from creditors in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, Binti wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Rashidi, who is in his mid-thirties, is married with four children; only one is still in school. He has been running a gengeduka (small, neighborhood store) business for four years now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Rashidi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase on the genge and start the duka. He is doing fine. He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

He will use this loan to restock the missing items in the gengeduka to meet his customers’ demand. He dreams of making his business grow.

Rashidi will share this loan with his loan group "Riziki", which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the gengeduka to meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en:
Peluce used the previous loan to buy more beds and other equipment for her hotel. She is still in a business of running a lodge and selling matooke (green plantain), plus she operates a salon to earn additional income. 

She became a businesswoman to provide for her family. She has a problem of limited capital and wants a loan to buy land for expanding her lodges.

loans.use: to buy land for expanding her lodges.

loans.name: Polycap

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders! Meet Polycap, who is 23 years of age, a hard worker, and a very honest farmer. He hails from the Kisii area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for banana farming. Polycap has one child whom he adores and cherishes, and a beautiful wife who always paints a smile on his face. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past six years and is making great strides. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling and personal business. These ventures have enabled him to send his child to school and feed his family. 

Polycap has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow, thereby enhancing his milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Polycap is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. 

With the loan, Polycap is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Polycap is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family.  With his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, he would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Polycap save more effectively. He plans to add value to his milk by packaging with his accumulated profits. He also hopes to start manufacturing milk products such as yogurt and cream one day.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is male, married with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a farmer, growing crops such as bananas, beans, maize and others. Charles is faced with a challenge of floods, which destroy his crops; he has a dream of expanding his business of bananas to the city. 

Charles will use the loan to buy fertilizer and manure to improve his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 37-year-old hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda; she is a farmer, growing tomatoes, and at the same time, selling matooke. She faces challenges of limited capital and weather changes, which hinder her progress and poor harvest. However, she hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. 

Rosemary needs a loan to complete constructing her house by buying materials like sand and cement.

loans.use: to complete constructing her house by buying materials like sand and cement

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 61 años de edad ha procreado 3 hijos con su esposa y habita en vivienda propia desde hace 20 años junto a ellos por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder darles un lugar donde vivir tratando siempre que sea lo mejor que este en sus manos. Él se gana la vida desde hace mucho tiempo prestando sus servicios de seguridad y es amparado en ese trabajo que trata de darles lo mejor. Como se puede observar en la fotografía la vivienda de Guadalupe carece de un muro perimetral que le permita tener un poco más de seguridad, es por ello y pensando siempre en su familia que Guadalupe ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en: 61-year-old Guadalupe has had three children with his wife and has lived in his own house for 20 years with his family. He feels very happy to be able to give them a place to live, and always tries to do the best he can with what he has. For a long time, he has made a living by offering his security services and he is protected in this job. As you can see in the photograph, Guadalupe’s house is lacking a wall around the perimeter of his property. A wall around the perimeter would allow him to have a little more security; for this reason, and because he is always thinking of his family, Guadalupe has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron so he can build a wall around the perimeter of his property.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron so he can build a wall around the perimeter of his property

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, tiene un salon de belleza desde hace 2 años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de la casa la joven vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos, ella solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is blurred in the picture is 20 years old, and she lives in a high-risk area. She has had a beauty salon in her place of residence for two years. She has many clients because she works very well, and the earnings she makes help with household expenses. The young woman lives with her parents and her two siblings. She is requesting a loan to purchase products for her beauty salon including shampoos, hair clips, and scissors among other things that she needs. In this way, she will be able to yield better earnings.

loans.use: buy hair creams, shampoos, hair clips, and scissors among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia  se sigue dedicando al trabajo como ama de casa,la socia cuida a sus nietos,por medio de su sueldo de jubilacion la socia sale adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Andrea still works as a homemaker. She cares for her grandchildren, and is getting by on her pension. Her dream is to have a grocery store. She is requesting a loan to buy a TV for her house.

loans.use: to buy a TV for her house.

loans.name: Srors

texts.en:
Srors, 30, lives in a small community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker with an income of USD 3 per day. His wife, Kern, 30, is a tailor who can make an income of USD 3 per day, too. This couple has three dependent children; one is in school while other two are not yet enrolled in school.

He is applying for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorcycle. 

Last but not least, he would like to thank to all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Julajean

texts.en:
Julajean is 34 years old and lives in Dumalinao, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three school age children. 

She has happily been doing her farming activity since she was in her 20's. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for cultivation of the land, and corn-seed preparation.  She sells corn in the market to help her husband, and support the needs of her three children. 

She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Julajean wants to see her children to accept their diplomas and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to cultivate land and corn-seed preparation

loans.name: Regelyn

texts.en:
Regelyn is a 25-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has two young children. 

Regelyn operates a small sari-sari, or variety store business. She sells goods and foods to the people in her place. This has been her source of income for several years now. Regelyn is sitting next to cases of soft drinks.

Regelyn is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among others.This loan will help Regelyn improve her stock in her store. 

In the future, Regelyn hopes to improve the sustainability and profitability of her store. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among others

loans.name: Ramie

texts.en:
Ramie is 48 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with eight children. She has a store that sells soft drinks, coffee and junk foods; sometimes she cooks different dishes to sell. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan to buy five cases of soft drinks, noodles and bread to meet the demand of her customers. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Ramie wants to extend her store with an eatery for more income.

loans.use: to buy five cases of soft drinks, noodles and bread

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is 65 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Genoveva has a four-room boarding house in the city and has had this business for 13 years. She has requested a loan to renovate her boarding house in order to retain her boarders and maintain cleanliness. Genoveva has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she would like to build another boarding house.

loans.use: to renovate her boarding house.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan sends you his thanks for your generosity, because his previous loan was a great help in his business. He was able to buy additional equipment, materials, and spare parts needed in his cellphone and computer repair shop. The loan also helped him provide for his family's daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could improve his service if you will lend him an amount of 12,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of spare parts and other materials that he needs in his shop. Better service and good profit will also result for his business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family. 

He will also use his loan to buy additional merchandise for his direct selling business.

Jonathan wants to give his family a better life through all his hard work in business. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and other materials needed in repairing cell phones and computers.

loans.name: Samantha Ximena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señorita  Samantha, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Ella estudia en una universidad en Manta. 
Ella tiene un local en el museo de la ciudad lugar que es muy visitado todos los días por turistas locales y extranjeros, allí vende todo tipo de artesanía elaboradas en paja toquilla, cerámica, madera y varios materiales más, ella con la ayuda de su mamá todos los días venden estos productos los mismos que son muy apreciados más que todo por los extranjeros que llegan hasta el lugar, lleva dos años con su local, compra las artesanías en la zona y también le traen de la sierra.
Este crédito es para comprar artesanías para surtir aún más su negocio. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
“Por Un Nuevo Amanecer” (For a New Tomorrow) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.
Here is where Samantha lives. She is 19, she is single and she lives with her parents. She is a student with the University of Manta.
She has a shop in the local museum of her town, a place that is daily visited by many local and foreign tourists. Here she sells every kind of straw, ceramic and wooden crafts, as well as art crafts made with other materials. With her mothers’ help, they sells these products every day, and it’s above all foreign tourists coming to this place who love the articles they sell. She has been running her shop for two years; she buys her crafts mainly in her area, but she also buy those coming from the mountains. 
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy crafts to increase the supplies for the shop. This is her fourth cycle with the Communal Bank, and she likes it because the interests on the loans are low. She dreams of completing her studies.

loans.use: To buy art crafts.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria earns through retailing various seafood, like shells and seaweed. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for house repair. She is on her way to repairing her house. 

She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for house repair

loans.name: Mugusu B Abamwe Group

texts.en: Robert is a member of Mugusu B Abamwe Group, where each member guarantees the others deal in selling produce of beans, groundnuts and maize, and at the same time farming and selling charcoal. He faces challenges of poor roads, especially during rainy seasons, and high transport costs. However, he hopes to expand his business to new markets, and to diversify his income by rearing cattle for milk production. Robert needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, who is a 37-year-old married woman, lives in the village Sartichala. She has 2 sons and a husband, who works as a private artisan. 

Marina is engaged in taking care of a poultry farm and from this activity she generates approximately 100 GEL per month. She has a great desire to expand the agribusiness and start dairy farming. That's why she requested a loan and was approved within the startup program that provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

She plans to purchase a milk cow, start producing milk-products, and sell them locally at a good price. Her business will be profitable, because of her nice attitude towards the clients, who have loyalty to Marina. 

The loan will greatly assist Marina and her family, as she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a room onto her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, underwear and men's shirts.

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad is a 50-year-old married mother of six children. She is a caring housewife who puts so much effort in supporting her beloved husband, who is a retired soldier with a limited monthly salary, in taking care of their children and providing them with the necessary living needs. Nohad manages properly how to distribute her husband's monthly income to cover all of her family's necessary living needs. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary wood logs, diesel and mouneh to get ready for warming up during the coming winter season.

Nohad is so anxious about this loan, and is working hard to open her own clothes selling shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary wood logs, diesel and mouneh to get ready for warming up during the coming winter season

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
THAN, 34, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has five dependent children in total. 

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for around ten years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average.  

Because the earnings that she can generate from farming is every little, now she has come up with a business idea. She wants to open a grocery store to serve people in her community. Therefore, THAN would like to apply for a KIVA loan that she will use as a capital investment to open a grocery store. 

With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her living standards. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús de 60 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar, ella tiene 29 años de contar con su vivienda que aunque es humilde es propia por lo que se siente muy feliz por ello. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 29 años se gana la vida con su pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas el cual realiza en su vivienda, gracias a la gran experiencia con la que cuenta, su cartera de clientes es bastante amplia, y cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos. Jesús es una mujer que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila en su vivienda, la cual le permita resguardar agua para el uso diario.
texts.en:
Jesús is 60 years old and lives in her own home together with her family. She has been in her home for 29 years. Although it is humble, it is her own and she is very happy to have it. She is a tenacious woman who for the past 29 years has had made her living at a small business selling tortillas. She runs the business out of her home. Thanks to the great experience she has, her customer base is very large and each day more customers request her products. 

Jesús is a woman that is always looking for a way to improve her quality of life. This is why she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a pila [washstand] in her home. This will allow her to save water for daily use.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a washstand in her home.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 51 years old, married, and had four children. She manages a food stall, cooking and selling pansit (noodles topped with meat, vegetables and egg). Her spouse also helps her in the business. They have been in their business for five years. 

Cherry is now asking for additional capital of P13,000 to buy pansit (noodles), meat, vegetables and soft drinks for her food stall. This will help maintain the delicious food she sells, and gain good profits as well. 

She hopes to save good funds and someday improve her stall.

loans.use: to buy pansit (noodles), meat, vegetables and soft drinks for her food stall

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 43 years old, married, and lived at Tuguegarao. She is a vendor selling grocery items to the people in her village. 

She wanted to gain more profits and sell more goods; that is why she is asking for additional capital of P20,000. This will be used in buying canned goods, soft drinks, breads, sugar and coffee to sell. 

She hopes this loan will help improve her sales; she plans to continue the friendly services she offers to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, breads, sugar and coffee to sell

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is grateful for the 8,000 PHP loan extended to her because she was able to purchase the necessary supplies and materials needed in her salon. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more supplies like shampoo, hair treatment cream, oils and other products needed in her shop. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cherilyn wants to give her child a good life and she hopes for her business to become more established and successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies for her salon, like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 49 years old, lives in Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental with her husband and three children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack vending. It began with selling a small amount of snacks to their neighbors. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in February of 2012. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 20,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her snack vending. She hopes that her business will continue, so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her snack vending.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has six children, ages one to 23. Her husband is a fisherman and also drives their motorcycle for passengers, for additional income. Myra helps in their fishing business for greater income. 

Fishing is never easy. There is the challenge of weather, but they work hard to provide for their family. Myra is requesting a loan to buy fishing weights, rope, nylon, and fishing nets. This will help, so the old items can be replaced. From her income, Myra will buy food for her family and pay for school fees.

In the future, she hopes to see her children succeed with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing weights, rope, nylon, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 37 years old, and has five children who are currently in school.

Josephine has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more material like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more material like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 48 years old and married with two children. Luciana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Luciana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, shampoo, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 39 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Leonora has a general store business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 36 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 27-year old married man with one child, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past four years he has been farming, growing food crops like maize for sale. He also works as a motorcycle rider for hire, but 80% of his daily earnings go to his boss. 

Roger does not have much money, yet from his small savings he has managed to educate his child. His dream is to buy his own motorcycle and provide his child with a higher level of education. He is requesting this loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Edwin. He is a 39-year-old farmer from Kipsaiya village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and three children on a small piece of land where he keeps dairy cows, poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. 

For ten years, his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. 

Edwin made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime last month, he applied for a loan for expanding his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. 

The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. 

With your loan, Edwin's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Mbaya

texts.en:
Mbaya is 32 years old. She is the second born in a family of six. She recently relocated from Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia, to Choma so that she can start running her own business. Her business deals in the sending and receiving of money. Her family lives in Lusaka. 

Mbaya knows the mobile money business very well, as she previously worked as a teller at her uncle’s Zoona booth for a year. Through her hard work, she saved up anough money to open her own shop. She is very happy to run her own business, despite the challenges she faces on a daily basis. The business is Mbaya’s only source of income. She uses the profits to provide for her basic needs, and sends money back home to her family.

Mbaya is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase two Zoona branded trading booths; this will help her save on rental costs and make sure her locations are easily located. She is hopeful that by getting the booths, she will attract more customers and earn more profits.

Mbaya is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for helping out small businesses like hers. She hopes that one day she will be able to help other people and to expand her business by opening more Zoona mobile money outlets.

loans.use: To purchase two trading booths

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with five children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda.
