Stephen has operated a retail shop of general merchandise for ten years; this has helped him provide for his family. He is also a farmer, growing crops such as beans, maize, rice, bananas, and cotton to sell and improve on his income. 

Stephen has a dream of completing his family’s house. He is faced with a challenge of bad roads, which make it difficult for him to transport his farm products. 

Stephen is in need of a loan to buy sugar, soap, soda, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soda, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Idibek

texts.en:
Idibek was born in 1994. He is a third year student at Tajikistan National University. Idibek learns Tajik language and literature. He often goes to the library and reads classic literature. 

In the future, he dreams of being a high quality specialist. Idibek is asking for a loan because he must pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy as you are the one who can support him.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
She is a businesswoman from Dulag, Leyte. Marilyn is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children. Her youngest child is 10. Out of the seven children, three are still attending school. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells items like noodles, salt, canned goods, chips, cooking oil, seasonings and soft drinks. Aside from that, she also engages in a fish vending business. Marilyn has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for the store and styrofoam for fish storage. With the additional stocks, Marilyn can now provide her children with proper diets and good living conditions.  

Marilyn would like to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store and styrofoam for fish storage

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is from the province of Iloilo, Philippines. She is 47 years old, and like some people in her place, she is also engaged in fishing. She works hard in order to help her husband who is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and a new boat engine. Ruby would like to expand her business, so she can save and support the education of her two children ages 10 and 13. In the future, she hopes to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new boat engine.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Thach, 51, lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In the last thirty years, she has been involved in agri-business. By owning farmland, she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers, and sometimes, she sells directly to customers at the market. On average, she can earn USD 3.00 a day. 

She has four single children, and one of her children is going to get married soon. However, she doesn't has enough money to prepare a wedding party for her child. Due to this reason, she would like to apply for Kiva loan to pay for wedding party preparation.She would thank to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to pay for wedding party preparation

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a sixty-seven-year-old widow woman from Dulag, Leyte. A mother of four grown children. She runs a sari- sari(variety) store. She sells goods like powdered juice, milk,spices, noodles, canned goods, soap and soft drinks. Aside from operating a store, she is  also into food vending business. She sells snacks foods like puto(rice cake). Erlinda  has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy assorted goods for the store, additional ingredients like flour,sugar,oil,margarine, yeast and purchase pigs for the start-up of her hog raising business.
With the additional capital, Erlinda will maximize its resources and eventually it will create high improvement in the whole family.

In the future, Erlinda hopes that her business will prosper that will help her  alleviate her status of living.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store, additional ingredients like flour,sugar,oil,mangarine , yeast and purchase pigs for the start-up of her  hog raising business

loans.name: Syra

texts.en:
Syra, 28, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Nassir, a tricycle driver and has one child who is still in the Preparatory Level in school. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to send her child to school. 

Syra operates a tricycle which her husband drives that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in provinces like Palawan, a tricycle is a common mode of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, their friend’s homes, and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 a day. She now has a backyard piggery business.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan which she will use for repairs and maintenance of her tricycle and also to buy feeds for her pig. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is badly needed in their area, and a piggery business is a profitable business since a pig can give birth to three to four piglets and they can easily be sold as roasted piglet.

Syra dreams of one day being more successful in business so she can give her child the best education possible and to ensure a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. It is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit and to buy feeds for her piggery business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia has been selling fish in their village to make a living. She has been doing this for  six years earning well for the family needs and business improvements.  She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying more fish to sell. She took a new loan recently to buy new fishing nets to improve her fishing activities. She plans to buy another fishing boat for business expansion in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets to improve her fishing activities.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn, whose previous loan was a big help in her retail business. She was able to buy more groceries needed to expand her variety store, and the loan also helped in the education of her children.

Analyn is requesting another 30,000 PHP loan to buy peanuts and candies needed in her repacking business. The resulting increase in profits will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn dreams of growing and expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and candies needed in her repacking business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enhanced her business. She was able to purchase peppers, misua (salted Chinese noodles), crackers, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products which are needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

Ruth is very positive that she could further improve her business, if you will let her borrow again, in the amount of PHP 20,000. This new loan will go to additional stocks of peppers, misua, crackers, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products to sell. 

Her customers will likely buy more items, if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales should also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

In addition to growing her business, Ruth aims to send all her children to school. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for peppers, misua, crackers, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has a selling purchase order cards business in the Philippines.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers. Purchase order cards are used to buy groceries, ready to wear clothing, etc. in replacement to cash if cash is not available.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years now.

Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Hazel Joyce

texts.en:
Hazel Joyce is 17 years old and is 1st of two children in the family. Her Mother Gemma supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Hazel Joyce is studying Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Hazel Joyce is borrowing Php 8000 to pay for tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When she graduates, Hazel Joyce plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 35 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Roselyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy a larger quantity of fibre to make textiles to sell for her customers. Anh previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fibre for making textiles.

loans.name: Abjelina

texts.en:
Abjelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Abjelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 41 years old and married. Riza works very hard to provide for her family.

Riza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as eggs, noodles, snack foods, biscuits, juice, cereals, etc., to sell.

Riza has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, snack foods, biscuits, juice, cereals, etc. 

Riza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as eggs, noodles, snack foods, biscuits, juice, cereals, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Not's Group

texts.en: Not is 38 years old and the father of two children. They live in the Preah Vihear province of Cambodia. He grows rice and soy beans to earn a living. Also, he grows cassava and raises cows to supplement his income. Not can earn an income about 19,400 KHR per day. This is his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this group of five, he is the leader. Not will spend his entire loan portion to buy solar panels. In the future, he hopes he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy solar panels.

loans.name: Aout's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Preah Vihear province, Aout is 30 years old and a mother of two children. For a living, she grows rice as her main source of  income. Moreover, she grows beans and raises cows and chickens to earn extra income. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her family will have electricity to use as other families do.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Somang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Preah Vihear province, Somang is 48 years old and a mother of three children. Struggling to make a living, she earns income to improve her family conditions via rice cropping and planting beans. 

She can earn an income about 25,600 KHR per day. She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can cut down on her spending so she can update her lifestyle to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Mwewa

texts.en:
Mwewa is a 33-year-old micro-entrepreneur who operates his own mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia.The business is his only source of income, and he works very hard to service his customers so that he can earn additional income. He is married, and has three children ages 10, 6 and 2 years old. His two oldest children go to school.

Mwewa is very happy to be connected to Kiva lenders. He sees this as an opportunity to grow his business. He explains that getting loans in Zambia is very difficult. One is expected to have collateral, and other requirements that make it very difficult. 

Mwewa has requested a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a Zoona branded trading booth. He will use the booth to serve his customers.

Mwewa is hopeful that one day he will be able to open more Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. This will help him earn more profits. The profits will go towards providing for his family. 

This is Mwewa’s first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth to serve his customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 38, runs his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business in the mining town of Kitwe, Zambia. He is married with a 2-year-old baby. With his first Kiva loan, Joseph was able to increase his mobile money float, thereby serving even more customers. He saw his profits grow, and was able to save up some money to open two more Zoona mobile money outlets.

He successfully repaid his first loan of $450 USD. 

Joseph is now requesting a subsequent Kiva loan to expand his successful business in two of the biggest markets in Kitwe. Joseph has carefully chosen the locations based on the large traffic of people at the markets, and he is excited to apply his business skills there.  He will use this loan to purchase two trading booths, which he can use to serve his customers.

Joseph thanks his Kiva lenders for the financial assistance that has changed his life for the better. 

He looks forward to expanding his business to improve the quality of life for his family and community.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money transfer business by purchasing two trading booths

loans.name: Msani

texts.en:
Msani is 34 years old. He lives in a rented house with his wife and their three children with ages between 6 months old and 15 years old. Two of his children go to school. Msani runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business in his hometown of Chipata, Zambia. His business deals in the transferring of money from one place to the other. He has four mobile money shops.

On any given day, Msani can be found moving around his four shops. He has employed four people to help him serve customers. He hopes to hire more as his business continues to grow.

Msani has requested a Kiva loan so that he can pay for his four trading booths. The trading booths help him to attract customers to his business. 

Msani has high hopes for the future. He hopes to open more Zoona mobile money outlets. This will help him to have more profits. He is hopeful that the increase in profits will improve his standard of living. Msani is grateful for the opportunity to be connected to Kiva lenders. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase four trading booths

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children who are all very active in helping her with the farm work. She has a specialized-secondary education, and she has been involved in agriculture since 2000. She currently owns three cows. 

She and her family also use 12.5 hectares of their own land to grow potatoes, cereals and bananas for their own domestic use and also for sale. Madina makes an average monthly income of about UGX 400,000.

Madina has turned to UGAFODE for a loan of UGX1,500,000. She will use this loan to buy additional livestock in order to increase her cattle headcount and the volume of milk that she produces and sells. 

She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her farming business. She would also like to save enough money to build a house for her large and friendly family.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Tailas

texts.en:
Tailas is 53 years old. He is a hard-working man with a great desire to learn. He is married and has seven children who are  29, 26, 23, 21, 19, 14 and 12 years old. Five of his children are in school.

Tailas owns a business in his home town of Ndola where he lives with his family. His business deals in mobile money transfer. This means that people go to Tailas’s shop to receive and send money to their loved ones. Tailas also sells shoes.

Tailas has applied for a Kiva loan to help him purchase a Zoona-branded booth, which will make sure he saves on rentals and his location will easily be accessed by his customers. Having more people go to his trading booth will significantly increase his profit margins. 

Tailas’s dream is to see his children through college. He is hopeful that with the help from Kiva, his business will continue to grow and he can make his dream a reality.This is Tailas’s first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the opportunity from all Kiva lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: To grow his business by purchasing a Zoona branded booth

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La necesidad de  seguir adelante en la vida ha llevado a Hortencia de 45 años de edad casada, a aprender algunos oficios.  A través de los años se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotaría es el motivo que ha motivado a realizar otro préstamo para tener otro capital para seguir en su negocio de abarrotería.  
	
Los créditos que se le han otorgado anterior mente le han sido de gran utilidad para  la compra de más mercadería de abarrotería, por medio de ello a obtenido gran logro en la vida. Antes cuando no tenía acceso a créditos ella no podía comprar sus mercaderías  para venderlas.
	
Además de que la gente lo busca para sus ventas de abarrotería, existen otras personas que lo buscan para que les haga alguna costura ya que también Hortencia es costurero y es agricultora en su bella comunidad y es un claro ejemplo de que si uno se propone realizar varias actividades en la vida una lo puede lograr.

Se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar otro  crédito para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para tener surtida su tienda y en la disposición productos de primera necesidad a las personas en su comunidad.  Además que le gustaría seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The need to keep moving forward in life has caused 45 year old, married Hortencia to learn various jobs. Over the years she has had a grocery store, for which she is seeking another loan to have capital to continue with her store.

The previous loans have been helpful to expand her grocery sales, though which she has been able to be successful in her life. Before when she didn't have access to loans she couldn't buy the merchandise to sell. In addition, people seek her store out.

In addition she is also a seamstress and often other people ask that Hortencia do some sewing for them. Lastly she also is a farmer! She is a clear example that if someone works hard and in various jobs in life one can be successful.

She has seen the need to seek another loan to expand her grocery business to better serve customers. Through this work she would like to continue supporting her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand her grocery store business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 40 years old and is a dedicated police officer. He is married with three children who are 7, 9 and 11 years old. All his children go to school. 

Raphael needs a loan to help him start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business.  He describes himself as friendly and hardworking. Raphael will use this loan to start a business of mobile money transfers by purchasing a trading booth, which he can use to serve his customers. 

Raphael explains how running his own business will give him the opportunity to improve his family’s life. He says the profit from the business will make providing for basic needs much easier. This prospect excites him and he cannot wait to begin operating his very own Zoona mobile money outlet. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To start running his own money transfer business by purchasing a trading booth

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a young 32-year-old lady who is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of four persons. 

Shamshad's husband owns a sanitary items shop. He has been running a sanitary items shop for the last ten years. He sells variety of sanitary items in his shop like PVC pipes, wash basins, bracket pairs for wash basins, lead (solder), looking glasses, etc. He requires some amount to buy more stock of sanitary items for his business.

So Shamshad made contact to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for loan. BRAC staff visited her husband's sanitary shop and issued loan. Shamshad is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sanitary items for her husband's sanitary items sale business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 19-year old college undergraduate and lives in Valladolid. She belongs to a family of 8. Her father is an OFW in Saudi Arabia and works as a site supervisor in a construction company. Her mother is a housewife. Joyce has 5 siblings. Her elder sister is in college and the rest are in high school or elementary. Their total monthly family income of Php 35,000.00 ($795) is barely enough to provide for everyone's many needs. This motivates Joyce to find means to help the family have more income that's why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping her family, Joyce also dreams to have a stable job and have a stable income. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Joyce have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Mufeedah

texts.en:
Mufeedah is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. Mufeedah is providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, a sewing machine, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase a new machine and accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Mufeedah is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her stitching business.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 34 year old Palestinian refugee who was born and raised in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. She has been raising her kids alone since her husband passed away four years ago. Her three boys are still at school and they are 11, 13 and 14 years old. 
Sahar has been working as a school teacher for ten years but with her husband's death, she started giving private tutoring classes at home to six students in order to increase her income and support the household's expenses. 
She also owns a small apartment inside the camp that she intends to rent for extra revenue. 
Sahar is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to improve the apartment and make it suitable for renting. 
The loan will therefore allow her to increase her monthly income and fulfill her commitment to see her children complete their high school education.

loans.use: to cover home improvement costs of an apartment she will rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is a 44 year old, divorced woman from Nablus city. She lives with her small son in a small simple house. Ten years ago, Najat started working as a photographer in a studio in the city. She now has very good experience. Najat loves her job and she would like to improve her production quality. 

Najat requested a USD loan from FATEN This loan will help her to buy a new video camera for her business. She will be able to improve herself and increase the income. 

Najat appears in the photo while she was working

loans.use: to buy a new video camera for her business.

loans.name: 032001010002.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a retail business selling dry fish. Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more processed fish to resell.

Hồng is 33 years old and she is married with two children. Hồng is the group leader of the 032001010002.Yên Phong solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

Hồng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hồng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more processed fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: René de 56 años de edad, desde hace 16 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde en la zona donde reside adicional a eso también se dedica al cultivo de jocotes por temporadas, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, René vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo quien le ayuda con el trabajo,  el esta solicitan do un crédito para la compra de mas ganado de engorde que le permita crecer en el negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: René is 56 years old. For the past 16 years he has worked raising cattle in the area where he lives. He also works growing jocotes (a tropical fruit) in season, selling his product in the surrounding villages. René lives in his own house with his wife and his son who helps him with his work. He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to fatten which will allow him to expand his business and have greater revenue.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: 020503060002 Phong Mỹ _ Hoằng Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm operates a food stall selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook and sell soup for breakfast.

Tâm is 49 years old and she is married with three children. Tâm is the group leader of the 020503060002 Phong Mỹ _ Hoằng Phong solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tâm has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes to maintain  a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to cook and sell soup for breakfast

loans.name: Nhóm 01, Thôn Thái Yên, Xã Công Chính, Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bản has a shop doing wedding photography, makeup, and other services. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to purchase instruments to maintain her wedding photography shop.

Bản is 38 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 01, Thôn Thái Yên, Xã Công Chính solidarity group. 

In 2011, Bản joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bản has successfully repaid 4 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bản has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bản faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bản hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain her wedding photography shop.

loans.name: 14 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Thúy makes salt. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to make salt for sale.

Thúy is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Thúy is the group leader of the 114 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc  solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Thúy first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Thúy has been involved in this business for 6 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to buy a motorbike, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase tools to make salt for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen had the skills and expertise to be a potter, yet she had no capital to start a pottery business. As a mother from Lopez Jaena, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she can and helping her husband earn an income. She joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start a pottery business. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the shape and quality of her pots. Helen has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her business to increase production and to purchase stock in bulk. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family. Today, other retail businesses sell her pots, which in turn helps them earn an income for their own family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her pottery business.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Amakan making (house walls made of bamboo) is the source of income for Normelita, who lives in Sindangan, ZDN, Philippines. She is 41 years old and married with children. She has expertise in her business and she is known for using a creative design for house walls. For more than 5 years, she has carefully manage her business that primarily supports her family.
Normelita signed up her membership with the Cooperative. She is borrowing money from PMPC to buy cement and galvanized roofing to have a comfortable home. With the help of PMPC, she can have a place called home.

loans.use: To buy cement and galvanized roofing to have a comfortable home

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is 65 years old, widowed, and cooks kakanin (rice desserts) to sell for income. Her daughter sells them to their neighbors and at the market. She had been in her business for over 10 years. She was able to sustain the needs of her family through her profits in her small business. 

Lucina is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar, coconut and vegetable oil use in cooking snacks. This loan will help maintain good profits in her food vending business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, coconut and vegetable oil to use in cooking snacks.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 children now in their adult age. 
Erlinda earns a living from RTW (ready-to-wear)dealing business for more than 3 years already. She is also receiving monthly pension as a surviving spouse from her late husband. Erlinda earns approximately PHP500.00 each month doing this type of RTW dealing business. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs and renovation. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to have her own RTW outlet.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma started her small time business and became successful in managing her sari-sari store. She needs to have enough inventories to serve her customers well. She rolls up her capital and additional revenue to gain more profit. Everyday she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently, she approached Paglaum for the much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil,and soy sauce.

loans.name: Mayriliam

texts.en:
Mayriliam and her sister own and operate Future Care Solutions in Miami, FL. Future Care Solutions provides clinical research and trials on cutting-edge medicine. Mayriliam employs four people, but finds that “we are short-staffed, and not able to keep up with the speedy growth.” But, she takes pride in “the acknowledgement and feedback from pharmaceutical companies and community-based groups.” Mayriliam is originally from Cuba and came to the US twelve years ago. She lives with her husband and in-laws.

Mayriliam needs a loan to buy beds, which will help expand her business, and establish her credit history. Her long term goal is “to learn and grow as a business person and maintain a sense of stability.” You can check out her business website: http://www.futurecaresolutionsllc.com/

loans.use: to buy beds to expand her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Because of her knowledge and experience in international sales and marketing, Martha decided to start her company to sell products to South American countries. She says, “I knew from experience that many small businesses of Central and South American countries, with limited resources and linguistic barriers, are looking for someone to help them negotiate in the world markets.” 

Martha is originally from Colombia and has lived in the US for over a decade. Her two partners and one employee are all part of her family.

Martha is most proud of becoming a vendor of the United Nation's Developed Program for Venezuela, but acknowledges that lack of financing can hold her company back from larger participation in programs with the United Nation. Martha’s first loan with Kiva helped buy materials to meet the contracts of these large programs. 

Now, Martha is looking to expand her business and needs a loan to help her export to other regions besides Central and South America. She will use her loan to advertise her business and for working capital. http://gv-distribution.com/

loans.use: to pay for marketing and working capital.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 41 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Margie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margie has been in pig fattening for 19 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Abovyan town with her husband, parents-in-law and daughter. 

The family runs a farm. Armine's husband in addition to farming, also earns money by working in the local gas station. 
This young and enthusiastic farmer in the photo, together with her in-laws, cultivates different fruit trees (peach, apricot, cherry and pear) as well as tomatoes. The gathered harvest they sell to local wholesalers and earn an income, which is very important for covering the family's daily costs.
 
Armine has now applied for this loan to be prepared for the new autumn cultivation season. She plan to use the loan in purchasing seeds and fertilizer and covering cultivation costs. This is very important for Armine and her family farm, so she hopes for lenders' goodwill and support, ensuring responsible payments

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Tyler

texts.en:
United Priority Distributors LLC (UPD) is working toward a $4,000 loan to assist in the manufacturing of cremation jewelry. This investment will help create a job in California and help a small family-owned business grow.

Tyler is the CEO and is working hard every day to help fill the cremation needs of the many funeral homes in the US. UPD Urns currently has over 1,500 cremation urns and keepsakes. But Tyler is confident there are some keepsakes that need to be made -- simple keepsakes that Americans would love. 

This $4,000 loan will go toward the manufacturing of 12 keepsakes for ashes. Cremation is growing rapidly in the US and is preparing to overtake traditional burial. Many Americans are choosing not only to opt for cremation, but also to keep the cremated remains of their loved one close in keepsakes. This increase in popularity of keepsakes and addition to funeral homes' revenue in cremation is why Tyler is confident this is a smart investment.

The landscape in the funeral profession is changing quickly. More baby boomers are dying. And that means interests are changing and purchasing behaviors are changing. UPD Urns seeks to offer what baby boomers want by focusing on the cremation jewelry segment and offering new and improved designs that families want.

UPD is confident this investment in inventory will help their California-based business grow and is a solid investment for the users of Kiva.

loans.use: to manufacture cremation jewelry.

loans.name: Ruth Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ruth una mujer luchadora de 21 años ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos que son la razón de su lucha y esfuerzo de cada día, ella vive y tiene su negocio en el Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón con un buen índice de progreso, el mismo que goza de un clima cálido húmedo por lo que sus tierras son muy productivas 
Ella ha tenido varios obstáculos en su vida uno de ellos fue el no haber podido estudiar porque sus padres son de bajos recursos, ella se inició en su actividad des de muy joven, tiene un negocio de ambulante de comidas rápidas, el mismo que lo aprendió con sus padres ayudándoles a vender en las calles desde muy niña en la actualidad trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias durante este tiempo no tiene quien le ayude tienen que buscar la forma de atender el negocio sin descuidar sus hijos, en el tiempo que tienen libre le gusta pasar buenos momentos con sus hijos
Lo más difícil en esta actividad es cuando tiene que llevar su triciclo de comida desde la casa al parque donde realiza las ventas, porque se necesita de mucho esfuerzo físico, tiene muchos sueños que quisiera realizar uno de ellos es comprarse un terreno para poder construir una casita propia, este préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio para comprar una salchipapera también para incrementar su capital de trabajo con esto atraerá más clientela y poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos la señora Ruth agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth is a fighter. She is 21 years old and a single mother. She has two children who are her motivation to fight and work hard every day. She lives and works in the Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton, which has a high development index. The weather is warm and humid, which results in very productive lands.

She has faced numerous obstacles in life. For instance, she could not study because her parents did not have enough money. She started working when she was young, selling fast food as a street vendor. She learned this from her parents, by helping them to sell food in the streets when she was a girl. She now works eight hours every day, on average. She takes care of her business on her own, so she has to find ways to keep an eye on her children while she works. She likes to spend her free time with them.

The most difficult thing for her is to take her food stall from where she lives to the place where she works, since it requires great physical effort. She has many dreams. One of them is to be able to buy a piece of land where she can build her own house.

Ruth will use this loan to buy a fryer to make “salchipapas” [a mix of sausages and potatoes] and to increase her working capital. This will help her to attract more customers and improve her income. Ruth wants to thank Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support that she and her family have received.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Odete

texts.en: A USD 800 loan is offered to Odete to improve her business. Odete lives in Dili. Most of her daily income is from selling shoes, so she is still happy to do her business. She started her business in 2010, with her own working capital of USD 450. She is taking this loan because she wants to add with her working capital to buy more shoes, socks, slippers, and other things to sell. She is happy with her activity that she doing every day because every day she earning a good income so she take this loan still to improve her management for her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin, so she could have more working capital to buy more shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes, socks, slippers, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 44 years old and lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a shop that sells different kinds of bread and has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for additional capital for her bakery to make any kind of delicious bread to get more customers. She wants to purchase inventories of flour, shortening, sugar and milk for her bakery business. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, shortening, sugar and milk for her bakery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en: Mrs. Oyuntuya, 34 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband are both opticians and they have been running an eye care center since 2000. Their elder son go to fifth grade at school while the younger one is in kindergarten. Her husband is currently studying architecture at the university and after graduation, he wants to build an apartment for business purposes. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy plot of land where the apartment will be built. She and her husband want to improve their living standard by beginning a new business. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares for her family deeply.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in order to build an apartment

loans.name: Chert's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Battambang province, Chert is 57 years old and a mother of seven children. For her family, rice farming is the sole source of income for her entire family and she has been occupied in this business for several years. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. For Chert, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get a good yield and her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, Ana es madre soltera vive junto a su hija y su madre en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de pollos desde hace 3 años, Ana quiere poner una venta de frutas y verduras ya que es un producto muy vendible en la zona donde ella reside, por esa razón esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 46 years old and is a very hard-working and responsible person who has dedicated herself wholeheartedly to her business. Ana is a single mother and she lives with her daughter and her mother in their own home. She has had a business selling chickens for three years. Now she wants to start selling fruits and vegetables, since they are very marketable in the area where she resides. For this reason Ana is asking for a loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale, in order to have a better income and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a sewer and install a toilet inside her house as her outhouse is not safe and not hygienic.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 10,000 PHP. She will use it to again buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add into her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros wants her store to become a grocery store. She only hopes for good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.


*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: A villager living in Kampong Cham Province, Noeun is 54 years old and a mother of five children. For her living, she earns income to support her family condition via porridge and Chinese noodle selling. For Noeun, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to pay for tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a Bachelor degree majoring in Accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a Bachelor degree majoring in Accounting.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman, and she has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Mercedita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 42-year-old, married mother of four children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started ten years ago baking, to cover the needs and expenses of her family.

Suzan is a hard worker and trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a refrigerator for her house. This is very important, to keep the food healthy.

Suzan hopes to expand her baking business more, in the future. She wants to expand, to increase her income and satisfy her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros makes a living through her poultry business. She is 58 years old and has been in the business for more than ten years now. She raises chickens to lay eggs, which she sells to the market. 

Milagros wants to expand her business, however, she lacks the financial capital to do so. Because of this, she decided to take a loan to buy more chickens and animal feed. This loan will enable her to improve her business as well as her income. 

In the future, Milagros hopes to make her business stable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as fried pork rind, fresh cheese, corn, beans, etc.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 61 years old and a resident of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has four, adult-age children. She and her husband have a little fishing business, from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realize that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. Aurelia and her husband work hard at selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish.

With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 7,000 loan. They will use this amount to purchase new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories, to be used in the chosen business. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Aurelia smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas, one day.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories to be used in her chosen business.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Anita has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs. Anita wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is an experienced and active farmer, from rural central Uganda. She has six children, and two dependent children who are currently enrolled in the local school. By operating a farming business, growing coffee and bananas on a small scale, she can earn around UGX 10,000 per day to support her family's daily demands. So far, she has been involved with this career for almost 20 years.

To keep her bananas and coffee growing well and provide larger yields, Mariam wants to use some natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy the fertilizer. She hopes that the fertilizer will help her bananas grow well and bring her more benefits. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous support. She is awaiting your kindness. Pictured is Mariam with the UGAFODE staff member (from left to right),

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is 34 years old and she is married. Her husband is Nurmat and he works in a collective farm. Manzura is careful mother of five children. All of them are non-adults. She is a very hardworking business lady. She has been busy with sewing national dresses more than 17 years. Manzura sews national style dresses and also European style dresses in her house where she has a workshop. Her sister-in-law helps her with sewing the dresses. Manzura has great experience in this field, and thanks to her hard work she has regular clients. Manzura is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy fabrics for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MOUGNOU ont en moyenne 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et la fabrication traditionnelle de vin. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe MOUGNOU sont à leur 3 ème   prêt solidaire. AWA, 1ère  femme debout à la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mils et du bois de chauffe pour la fabrication du vin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place avec les paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who make up the MOUGNOU group are, on average, 44 years old and also have an average of six children each. They all live in extended traditional families in Tominian / Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through families ties, and they are involved in buying and selling various products and grains, and in the production of traditional wine. Having successfully repaid their previous loans, the members of the MOUGNOU group are now on their third solidarity loan.

Awa, standing first from the left in the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy five bags of millet as well as some firewood to make some wine. She stocks up locally, from farmers. She sells to both men and women and gets paid in cash and also often on credit. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be used to take care of some health-related expenses, and to feed, clothe and educate her children. Awa will reinvest the rest of the money into her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make traditional wine.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 69 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is widow with one adult age son. She has four rooms of boarding house in the city. Every room is equivalent to PHP 2,000 for four people. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for house renovation to make her comfortable. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gloria wants to extend her boarding house and earn more to save.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation.

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en: Hermie is 25 years old. He is single and lives in Carles, Iloilo. At a young age, Hermie learned fishing from his family. He started fishing when he was 15.  This has been his source of income. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fishing weights, nylon rope and fishing nets. Hermie works hard so he can help his parents. He dreams of expanding his business to save for a better life for himself, his parents and his future family.

loans.use: to buy fishing weights, nylon, rope and fishing nets.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian's primary business for the last ten years has been rental houses. At the same time, she manages a food kiosk. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings). Lillian is married to Augustine, and blessed with five children aged 26, 24, eight, five, and three years old.

She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, and intends to use the entire loan amount to renovate the rental houses and buy some food to sell in the kiosk.

Lilian will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be stable in her business.

loans.use: to renovate the rental houses and buy some food for sale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Manuela is 38 years old and all of her children are in school.

Manuela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Manuela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 37 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, canned goods, eggs, candies, and coffee. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her general store

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives on a hilltop in Kapsowar, Kenya with his wife and children. From his small, but immaculately clean, mud house he can see a lush valley full of maize, tomatoes, beans, and vegetables. He can also see a bright future, thanks to the income he earns through practicing mixed farming. 

Edwin passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one his cows “Birir” (from a person’s name). Because of his immense farming knowledge, he has turned his farmland into an open university. Here, hundreds come to get trained, in the hope that they will replicate his model in their own farmland. 

The biggest challenge he faces is satisfying the demand for milk in his village. The demand is overwhelming. He is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. He believes that through the loan he will be able to improve his living conditions, and be able to secure the future of his children. He has gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, and is confident that the skills he acquired will help him increase his business and be able to pay back the loan. Edwin is confident that if you invest in his dream, you will be impacting the life of his family and children.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Ayoub, who is in his mid 20s, is single.  He has been running a barber shop for three years now.  He works from 7 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Ayoub's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his salon equipment, like buying an up-to-date shaver, flexible chairs, ect. and has been able to pay back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to take care of himself and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products to meet his customers' requests.  He dreams of opening his own barber shop.  

Ayoub will share this loan with his loan group "Vigae", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products to meet his customers' requests.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has been engaged in a pig raising business for more than 10 years now. She is married and has a 9-year-old child with her husband. She lives with her family in Leyte, Philippines. Her husband earns an additional income through fishing.

Rosalie needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is requesting for a loan to buy more animal feed for the pigs. This will help her improve her business as well as her income. Rosalie hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, cereals, etc. to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, cereals, etc. 

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Integracion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Integracion está en su ciclo número Octavo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Daniela, quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando, gracias a su trabajo y a los seguimientos y capacitaciones que va recibiendo.  Ella tiene una mercería donde tiene todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, artículos varios de bazar y demás. 
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para su mercería, como ser prendas varias, calzados y artículos de mercería lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, y a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Integracion" (integration) is in its eighth cycle of the women's committee programme. They all work and help each other to get ahead.

One of the members is Daniela. Her results in the latest "eliminating poverty" survey showed a level of poverty within level three. This shows an improvement, thanks to her work and to the monitoring and training she's been receiving. 

She has a haberdashery store selling all kinds of products such as clothes, gifts, household items etc.

Daniela is asking for this loan to buy various products for her store, such as clothing, footwear and haberdashery items which will help her realize her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear and haberdashery items

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Sololá está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. Entre esos grupos se encuentra Petrona de 26 años de edad, ella realiza un enorme esfuerzo para sostener a su familia, ella tiene 3 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad ella es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes sueños en la vida.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de verduras, ella eligió dicha actividad porque le genera ingresos económico para su familia, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 5 años y lo aprendió de su mama, a ella le gusta realizar esta actividad porque por medio de ello a mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia y también la de su comunidad. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la siembra de zanahoria en un terreno que tiene disponibles cerca de su casa donde ella vive.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de verduras y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus siembras para obtener buenas cosechas y mejorar sus ventas en el mercado de su comunidad con buenas cosechas. La aspiración de ella es agrandar su negocio y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It is a very warm day, the market of Solola is full of people that come and go, some buying and others selling. Hope dances between the two groups. Petrona, 26 years old, is in one of those groups. She makes a huge effort to support her family. She has three children, all of which go to the school in her community. She is an entrepreneurial woman with great dreams in life. 

Her main occupation is the purchase and sale of vegetables. She chose this activity as it generates an income for her family. She has had this job for 5 years and learned it from her mom. She likes doing it because it has helped her improve her family's living conditions and also those of her community. Her second occupation is growing carrots in a plot of land that is available to her near her home. 

She will use the loan to buy vegetables and fertilizer to improve her crops and her sales in the market. Her goal is to enlarge her business and build houses for her children so that they have good living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tu buy suits and shoes and to pay graduation expenses at his son's school.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Only one of them is still studying. She is a vegetable vendor and uses her bicycle to sell her goods. She sells them on a house-to-house basis rather than staying in a stall. 

Erlinda is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy eggplant, tomatoes, and cabbages to sell. She hopes to sell more vegetables and continuously gain good sales from it. Someday, she hopes to raise hogs for additional profits and save money for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Hazratjon

texts.en:
Hazratjon was born in 1956. He is married and has six children. His wife is a housewife. Hazratjon went to school up until higher education. He is a teacher and has worked in a school for more than 20 years. 

Hazratjon has had a great experience teaching, and he is one of the best teachers. Hazratjon always wanted to provide his children with the opportunity to attend higher education. He dreams of seeing his children as good specialists. 

Now, one of his sons is a student, and Hazratjon must pay for his tuition. Hazratjon is asking for a loan of 1,900 USD to pay for his son's tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition

loans.name: Iris Haydee

texts.es: Iris de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su sobrina, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar materia prima como chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, frijoles, etc. y así poder seguir con la elaboración de las pupusas y poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Iris, 47 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children and her niece.  She has worked for 5 years making and selling pupusas.  Her business is located in her house and she has many customers.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials like shredded pork, fresh cheese, corn, beans, etc., and in this way she will be able to continue with making pupusas and she will be able to have a better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like shredded pork, fresh cheese, corn, beans, etc.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through her hog raising business. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a driver.

Rosana is asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit. 

In the future, Rosana hopes to make her business profitable and sustainable. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Virginia has been in this business for five years now.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 5 hijos y solo su hija la menor esta  con ella. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos. Su pareja es agricultor desde hace 10 años, solo él y su hija viven con ella.

Rosa es comerciante, tiene un puesto en el mercado, en el que vende frutas y verduras, aprendió esta actividad gracias a su madre que también se dedicaba a lo mismo, Rosa también tiene una pequeña granja de pavos y recibe una ayuda económica de sus hijos en el extranjero.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar maya para gallinero para mejorar su granja, comprar más pavos para desarrollarlo y estén listos en la época navideña que es cuando más se venden y quiere aprovecha para hacer un buen negocio. Sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y estar tranquila en su casa con su esposo y seguir trabajando en su granja.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55, is in a common-law marriage and has five children.  Only her youngest daughter lives with her.  Rosa was only able to study up to fourth grade because her family lacked the resources.  Her partner has been a farmer for 10 years.  Only he and her daughter live with her.

Rosa's a merchant.  She has a stall in a market where she sells fruits and vegetables.  She learned this work thanks to her mother, who also earned a living in that line of work.  Rosa also has a small duck farm, and she receives financial help from her children who are abroad.

She'll use the loan to buy chicken-coop mesh to improve her farm.  She'll also buy more ducks to raise so they'll be ready for the Christmas season, when duck sells best.  She wants to make the most of it to do a good business.

Rosa dreams of improving her quality of life, of living peacefully in her house with her husband, and of continuing to work on her farm.

loans.use: to buy ducks as well as chicken-coop mesh

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 33 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 1 hijo de 2 meses de edad y es el padrastro de dos jóvenes de 18 y 15 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica. Su pareja es ama de casa, el su hijo e hijastros son los únicos que viven con él y depende completamente de él.

Pedro es empleado, trabaja como electricista para una empresa, por el momento no trabaja  porque sufrió un accidente laboral del que ya casi se recuperó por completo, también hace trabajos particulares cuando se lo solicitan.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una cama para él y su pareja, una cuna y para la compra de medicinas para que termine de recuperarse.

Pedro sueña con tener su propio negocio como electricista y contar con todas las herramientas y equipo que necesita para dar su servicio, también que su hijo termine una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Pedro is 33 years old, married and has one son 2 months old and he is the stepfather of two teenager ages 18 and 15. He completed a 9th grade education. His spouse is a housewife and his wife, child and stepchildren live with him and depend completely upon him.

Pedro is employed as an electrician for a business. At the moment he isn't working because he was in a work accident and is still recuperating. He also does small jobs when possible.

The loan will be used to buy a bed for him and his wife, a crib, and medicines to finish his recovery. Pedro dreams of having his own electrician business and having all the tools and equipment needed to provide such service. He also dreams of his child finishing a career at the university.

loans.use: to buy a bed for him and his wife, a crib, and medicines to finish his recovery.

loans.name: Vechheka

texts.en:
Vechheka is 20 years old, a student at a university in the city. He is from Kandal province in Cambodia. His major is banking and finance. 

To support his studies, he has been working as a security guard at an institution since 2013, earning approximately $5.90 daily. Due to the fact that he is short on finances to pay for his university fees, Vechheka would like to request a loan. This loan will help him finish the second year successfully. For his future job, he wants to work for any bank or microfinance institution.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 39-year-old, married father of two children. He is a Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon (especially those who live in a camp), and the limits placed on their work access, he started eight years ago working as an electrician. His aim was to cover the needs and expenses of his family, but his salary is limited.

Bassam is a hard worker and has a good reputation in his area. As he is trying desperately to provide his family with better living conditions, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy a freezer for his house, which is very important to keep their food healthy and fresh.

Bassam hopes to start working as an electrician on his own. Working for himself may increase his income and improve his family's financial and social situations.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and to pay for medical treatment for his wife.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola was born in 1968 year. She is married. Her husband is a driver. They have four children. Lola is going to start her own business, in the field of sewing. She will provide service to local women, as a seamstress. Lola will provide service to her customers in a workshop. She hopes her business will go successfully.

Lola studied at the course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ offered by a women's organization, and she got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Rolando Baltazar

texts.es:
Rolando de 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad que esta estudiando 8° grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y su hijo viven con él y depende totalmente de él.

Rolando es comerciante, tiene 8 años de vender lácteos, queso dura blando, queso añejo y crema, pero también  vende dulces, juguetes, pulsera, collares y demás. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 6 marquetas de queso duro blando para dejarlo añejar y aprovechar el mes de diciembre que es cuando mejor precio tiene. 

Rolando planea expandir su negocio, ya que cuenta con suficiente espacio y con una muy buena ubicación.
texts.en:
Rolando is 37 years old, married and has a son 13 years old who is studying in the 8th grade of primary education.  His wife is a housewife and she and their son live with him and are totally dependent on him.

Rolando is a merchant, has been selling for 8 years.  He sells milk, hard cheese, soft cream cheese and aged cheese.  He also sells sweets, toys, watches, necklaces and others things. The loan will be used to buy six big blocks of hard cheese to let it age and take advantage of the month of December which is when prices will go up.

Rolando plans to expand its business as it has plenty of room and a great location.

loans.use: to buy six big blocks of mild hard cheese.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 2ª grado. Es soltero y se dedica a la agricultura y a la criá y venta de ganado, de él depende su hermana.

José se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, el negocio lo aprendió de su padre, ya que desde pequeño su padre lo inculco.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado para criarlo y venderlo y así tener mas ingresos para él y su familia.
