Desea que su ganado se desarrolle en buen estado y que al final tenga mas ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old and studied through 2nd grade. He is single and works in agriculture and also raises and sells cattle. His sister is economically dependent on him.

The loan he is requesting is to buy cattle to raise and sell so he can have more income for himself and his family.

He hopes his cattle will grow well and that in the end he will have more income.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell so he can have more income for himself and his family.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Su espíritu emprendedor, las ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida y sacar a sus hijos adelante son aspectos que identifican a Don Alejandro. Él es un hombre muy responsable con su familia, en la comunidad donde vive las personas lo aprecian y lo respetan pues siempre está dispuesto a ayudar en lo que pueda. Él tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado desde hace 32 con la señora Justina quien es ama de casa, juntos formaron una familia con 11 hijos, muy sonriente Don Alejandro comento “casi mi equipo de fútbol solo me falto uno”. Dos de sus hijos aún dependen de él y sólo uno continúa estudiando.

Don Alejandro tiene mucha experiencia en diversas actividades, cuando tiene la oportunidad, trabaja en la construcción de casas, en el campo cultivando maíz, cría borregos y tiene un taxi, en el cual invierte la mayor parte de sus horas. Actualmente necesita un préstamo pues quiere juntarlo con sus ganancias y cambiar su vehículo pues el actual ya ha estado fallando mucho y no puede no puede trabajar confiablemente porque teme que se le descomponga en cualquier punto de su viaje y no le gustaría quedar mal con sus pasajeros. Alejandro decidió comenzar esta actividad porque en su localidad casi no hay transporte se debe caminar varios kilómetros para llegar al punto donde pasan algunos vehículos. En varias ocasiones sus vecinos necesitaban salir de emergencia y le pedían apoyarlos con su auto a cambio de un pago, fue por eso que comenzó el servicio. 

Don Alejandro, está muy agradecido por esta oportunidad de mejorar en su negocio. 

*La imagen se tomó en la plaza del municipio donde vive Alejandro.
texts.en:
His enterprising spirit, his desire to improve his quality of life, and his desire to get his children ahead are features that identify Alejandro.  He is a very responsible man with his family.  In the community where he lives the people value and respect him.  He is always willing to help in whatever he can.

He is 53 years old, and he has been married to Justina for 32 years.  Justina is a housewife, and together they make a family with 11 children.  A very smiling Alejandro said, “It is almost my soccer team, I only need one more”.  Two of his children are still dependent upon him.  Only one of them is continuing in school.

Alejandro has a lot of experience in diverse business activities.  When he gets the chance, he works building houses, in the field growing corn, raising sheep, and he has a taxi.  He spends most of his time in the taxi.

He currently needs a loan.  He wants to put it together with his earnings and change his vehicle.  His current vehicle has been breaking down a lot.  He is not able to work reliably because he is afraid that it will stop working at some point of his trip.  He does not want to look bad to his passengers.

Alejandro decided to start this business activity because there is hardly any transportion in his area.  You need to walk various kilometers to get to the point where some vehicles pass by.  On various occasions his neighbors needed to leave on an emergency, and they asked for help with his auto in exchange for payment.  That is how he started the service.

Alejandro is very grateful for this opportunity to improve his business.

*The photo was taken in the plaza of the municipality where Alejandro lives.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, personal hygiene products, condiments, cooking products, drinks, and other items to start a store and also to harvest his crop.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: Melina de 23 años de edad es soltera. Ella pertenece a La Alcancía Comunal “Sarita Colonia” conformada por 06 socios solidarios y responsables. Melina se dedica a la venta de plásticos. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de comida. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de plásticos. Su mayor deseo es incrementar el volumen de sus productos. El grupo “Sarita Colonia” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Melina es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
Melina, age 23, is single. She belongs to to the Communal Bank "Sarita Colonia" made up of 6 responsible and supportive members. Melina has made a living from the sale of plastics. Likewise as a secondary occupation she has made a living from the sale of food. Thanks to her efforts she has improved her quality of life. Her latest loan will be used for the purchase of plastics. Her greatest desire is to increase the volume of her products. 

The group "Sarita Colonia" is grateful to those who are making this loan possible and promise to keep working well. Melina is pictured third from the left with the white t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy plastics.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
O senhor Joao  é professor, de 35 anos de idade, pai solteiro de 3 filhos 2 dos quais a estudarem e 1 ainda menor vive na casa própria.
Ele diz que com este valor irá comprar chapas de zinco e cimento , barrotes, pedra, para dar contiinuidade a construcao da  casa onde vive casa onde já vive na casa.
No futuro tem como planos fazer o muro de vedaçāo de seu quintal, terminar a casa e fazer uma nova num espaco reservado para tal, terminar seus estudoa na faculdade onde se encontra a frequentar o 2o  ano.
Diz que ira pagar conforme o calendario e solicitar mais emprestimos como forma de concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Joao is a 35-year-old teacher. He is a single father to 3 children, 2 of whom are studying and 1 who is still too young for school. He lives in his own home. He says that he will use this loan to buy zinc sheeting, cement, joists and stone in order to carry on with building work on his house. In the future he plans to erect a wall around the back garden of his home, finish building his house and build another one in a space which he has reserved for this purpose. He also plans to complete his studies at the educational institution where he is currently in the second year of his course. He says that he will comply with his loan repayment schedule and apply for further loans to fulfil his plans.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, cement, joists and stone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the condition of his home by building a perimeter wall for his family's security.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has been selling made-to-order products for years. She also makes fruit shakes and other delicacies available for reselling. Imelda used the income from her previous loan to buy frozen food products needed to increase her inventory, and she successfully repaid her loan.

Imelda is now requesting a new loan, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in making peanut butter. She will use her loan to improve her sales, and she will use her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. She is thanking you, in advance, for whatever amount you are willing to lend her.

She still desires to have more customers to serve. She is hoping for financial progression and stability in her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed in making peanut butter.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel cuenta con dos hijos: el primero de 6 años de edad y es estudiante de la escuela de su comunidad, el segundo de 3 años de edad  que aun no estudia, el es un hombre emprendedor que no le importa qué actividad realizar sino lo único que a el le importa es tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la compra y venta de ropa típica en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que el a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de jornalero en su comunidad y por medio de esa actividad el puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada  para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

El es muy emprendedor en la vida y es por ello que el se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa típica, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta.

La aspiración más importante de el es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel has two children. The first is 6 years old and is a student at the community school and the second is three years old and does not attend school yet. He is an entrepreneur who does not mind what work activity he does, rather the only thing that is important to him is to have financial activity for the benefit of his family.

The productive activity that he does to earn money in the economic system is buying and selling traditional clothing in his community as it is the unique way he has been able to find to earn income for his family. His second activity is serving as a day laborer in his community and through this activity he can have another extra income in order to maintain his family and give the appropriate well being for his children so they become good professionals.

He is enterprising in life and that is why he decided to ask for a loan in order to buy typical clothing merchandise in order to have more stock on hand for his customers in order to sell it.

His most important goal is to build better housing and give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing to sell

loans.name: Yahaya Wakili

texts.en: Yahaya Wakili is a maize farmer from Kukoki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya Wakili would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya Wakili can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya Wakili, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet immediate expenses like food and clothing while eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín: Es un joven trabajador, tiene 20 años de edad, soltero. Con el propósito de apoyar en el negocio familiar de sus padres, una mini distribuidora, desde hace 1 año asumió el rol de mejorar los ingresos familiares, razón por la cual solicita  su primer financiamiento para incrementar inventario de productos: granos básicos, detergentes, cloros, ambientadores, jabón de baño, de lavar ropa, de lavar traste, chiverías, jugos, refrescos, productos lácteos, entre otros.  Su sueño es crecer más en su negocio y llegar a establecer una abarrotería.
texts.en: Efraín is a hardworking young person.  He is 20 years old and single.  In order to support his parent's business, a small general store, he took charge of improving the family's finances a year ago.  In order to do this, he is requesting his first loan to increase the inventory of products like basic grains, detergents, bleach, air fresheners, bath soap, laundry detergent, dish soap, sodas, dairy products, and others.  His dream is to grow the business and start a grocery store.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of basic grains, detergents, bleach, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a drainage system and install a toilet that is more hygienic than the latrine and less dangerous for children to use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to continue building a wall of her house so that she can offer better security to her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, iron, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Phalin

texts.en: Phalin is 23 years old and a second-year administrative university student. He is married and works as a security guard at an institution in a city. Being a guard, he can earn approximately 4.33 USD per day. His wife is 21; she sells sweets and earns approximately 35 USD a day. Because of a shortage of finances, Phalin would like to request a loan to pay for his second-year tuition. With the loan, he will be able to finish his second year at university successfully. After graduation, he wants to find a better job so he can save money to buy his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his second-year tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Erena

texts.en:
Erena, 57, is retired and works washing and sewing upholstery to supplement her income. She lives with her husband who works at a gas station, but also is about to retire. She also lives with a daughter, a grandson and an adopted daughter. The daughter wants to be in her parents' house only temporarily, but needs their support until her financial situation improves. Erena sought out Banco Pérola at a moment when her retirement could not pay the expenses of having her daughter back home. 

To fulfill all the orders that receives, she needs to buy a sewing machine, a steamer and cleaning materials specifically designed for this type of application.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a steamer and cleaning materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated roofing material, purlines, cement, block, sand, and the labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other items to sell.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel: Es un hombre amable, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 39 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos menores de edad. Solicita su primer financiamiento, para cubrir gastos médicos y viajar a Managua a realizarse estudios y análisis médico. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto, para que su familia viva más segura.
texts.en:
Abel is a kind man. He is from Puerto Cabezas, is 39 years old, and is married with three young children.

He requests his first loan to cover medical expenses and to travel to Managua for medical tests and analyses.

His dream is to build his house from concrete so that his family can live more safely.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses and to travel to Managua for medical tests and analyses.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German: Es un hombre luchador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, casado, tiene 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 6 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Chiverías, granos básicos, pan, entre otros productos. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto,  ya que habita en una vivienda de tambo, de madera.
texts.en:
German is a determined man. He is from Puerto Cabezas, is married, and has three school-age children. With the goal of having his own source of income, six years ago, he started a small grocery store. 

He requests a loan to buy merchandise, including snacks, basic grains, and bread, among other products. 

His dream is to build his home from concrete, since he currently lives in a stilt home made of wood.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including snacks, basic grains, and bread, among other products.

loans.name: Zorayda

texts.es: Zoraida: Es una joven luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 25 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos, en edad escolar, es docente de educación primaria. Desde hace 25 años habita casa de sus padres, vivienda de tambo de madera, que se encuentra en mal estado, razón por la cual solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: zinc, madera, clavo y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Zoraida is a young fighting woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas. 

She is 25 year old, a single mother of three school age children. She teaches elementary school. 

She has lived with her parents for 25 years in a wooden farm house that is in poor condition. This is the reason she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as zinc, wood, nails and to cover the labor costs. 

Her dream is to build her own concrete home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as zinc, wood, and nails, and to cover the labor costs

loans.name: Jocote Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres alegres y luchadores, que se organizaron desde hace 6 meses, con el objetivo de  conformar el grupo solidario Jocote y para acceder a financiamiento y comprar mariscos para su comercialización.

Almaira: Es una mujer joven, madre soltera, tiene una hija,  originaria de Puerto Cabezas, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijas y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mariscos en la comunidad de Lamlaya y venderlos a precios accesibles en la Ciudad de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener una pulpería.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jocote consists of three happy fighting women who formed the group six months ago with the objective of forming a solidarity group in order to access financing and to buy seafood to sell.

Elmira is a young single mother with a daughter. She is originally from Puerto Cabezas. In order to bring up her daughters and to have her own source of income she has been selling seafood for two years.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seafood in the Lamina community to sell at an affordable price in the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy seafood in the community of Lamlaya to sell.

loans.name: Prospera Group

texts.es:
Próspera es el nombre que decidieron poner las integrantes a su grupo de préstamo pues dicen que ellas prosperaran con sus negocios y con la oportunidad que VisionFund les otorga con un crédito. 

Las integrantes son mujeres muy responsables, trabajadoras, quienes día con día han buscado la manera de darle a su familia lo mejor, de esta manera cada una inició su actividad económica. Las clientes y sus actividades son:

Soledad- Venta De Pollo
Deodora –Venta De Tacos, Queso, Churros.
Ana - Venta de Calzado Por Catalogo, Tortillería Y Oro Laminado
Dora - Venta de Lencería Para Dama, Calzado Por Catálogo, Carnicería Y Oro Laminado.

Doña Deodora es una señora alegre y responsable, está casada con el señor Rodolfo y son padres de 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno de ellos es menor de edad. Doña Deodora se ha dedicado al comercio, actividad que desempeña toda su familia. Hace 10 años comenzó vendiendo ropa, calzado por catálogo, tacos, queso y churros. Deodora siguió los pasos de toda su familia que también es comerciante “el negocio de la comida es lo mejor”.

En la actualidad, tiene tres carritos de tacos de feria, que a lo largo de los 10 años le ha ayudado a llegar a tantos lugares y vivir tantas experiencias. Lo que más le gustó fue haber visto a Los Tigres del Norte (un grupo mexicano muy reconocido) en la feria de Cuichapa. 

Cada uno de los negocios de Deodora lleva el nombre de uno de sus hijos pues está pensando en dejarles un sustento para cuando ella no esté más con ellos. Además, Deodora da empleo a 7 personas, apoyando de esta forma a más familias. Ella quiere invertir en platos, vasos, sillas, mesas, manteles, servilletas pues está a punto de abrir un pequeño restaurante en otra comunidad para lo cual necesita contratar a dos personas más. Deodora espera tener excelentes ganancias con la fonda para invertir en un nuevo negocio.

*En la imagen: doña Deodora es quien viste blusa floreada y falda color vino.
texts.en:
Próspera is the name these members chose for their credit group, because they say that they prosper with their businesses and the opportunity that VisionFund offers them through loans. 

The group is made up of very responsible, hard-working women who in their daily lives have searched for a way to give the best to their families, and in this way began their economic activities. The group members and their businesses are:

Soledad- sells chickens
Deodora – sells tacos, cheese, and churros.
Ana – sells shoes by catalog, tortillas and gold plated jewelry.
Dora – sells lingerie for women, shoes by catalog, meat, and gold plated jewelry.

Deodora is a cheerful and responsible woman. She is married to Rodolfo and they have four children, of which only one is still a minor. Deodora works as a vendor, as do all the members of her family. She started 10 years ago selling clothes, shoes by catalog, tacos, cheese, and churros. Deodora followed in the footsteps of all her family members, who were also vendors. She says that “the business of selling food is the best”. 

She currently has three taco carts for fairs, that over the last ten years have enabled her to visit so many places and live so many experiences. Her favorite was when she got to see Los Tigres del Norte (a very famous Mexican band) at a fair in Cuichapa. 

Each of Deodora’s businesses are named after one of her children, because she is planning to leave them a means of earning a living for when she is no longer with them. Also, Deodora employs seven people, in this way helping to support more families. She wants to invest in plates, glasses, chairs, tables, tablecloths, and napkins for the small restaurant she is about to open in another community, and for which she will need to hire two more employees. 

Deodora hopes to earn a good income with the funds invested in the new business. 

*In the picture: Deodora is wearing a flowered shirt and wine colored skirt.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, chairs, tables, tablecloths, and napkins for the small restaurant she is about to open.

loans.name: Monedas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras, se integraron desde hace 6 meses, con el propósito de salir adelante y mejorar sus pequeños negocios. 

Alexa: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Monedas, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos ofrece sus servicios de estilismo a domicilio. Solicita financiamiento para comprar productos: Pinturas de uñas, acetonas, tintes, uñas acrílica entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
This solidary group is composed of three feisty, enterprising women.  They came together six months ago with the objective of getting ahead and improving their little businesses.
Alexa is a feisty woman originally from Puerto Cabezas who is married and has two minor children.  She is the coordinator of the solidary group Monedas.  With the objective of having her own source of income, she offers stylist services at home.  She is requesting financing in order to purchase nail polish, acetone, dyes, and acrylic nails among other products.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, acetone, dyes, and acrylic nails, among other products.

loans.name: Yurielka Group

texts.es: Jhondra: Es una joven luchadora, tiene 21 años de edad, tiene un pequeño hijo. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos se desempeña como estilista y vende productos de belleza, cosméticos por catálogos.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar: perfumes, vanidades, pinturas, sombras, entre otros cosméticos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Jhondra is a feisty, young woman who is 21 years old and has a little son.  With the objective of having her own source of income, she works as a stylist and sells beauty products and cosmetic from catalogues.  
She is requesting financing to buy perfumes, trifles, blushes, and eyeshadows amongst other cosmetics.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, trifles, blushes, and eyeshadows amongst other cosmetics.

loans.name: Hadicha

texts.en:
Hadicha, 22, lives in her own house with her family. She makes clothes for a living and works from home. She has worked in this field for four years and has a lot of experience as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her.

Hadicha makes a variety of items of clothing and sells them at very affordable prices. Her work is of good quality, which is why many people come to her. 

She has decided to request a loan from IMON International to invest in her small business. She will use the loan to buy two sewing machines to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Fifty-eight-year-old Elvira is a widow who hails from the municipality of Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in fishing for 46 years now. This was her source of income when her children were little. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon and floaters. Elvira knows the importance of replacing her tools on time to maximize productivity. She hopes that the loan will make it easier to continue doing her fishing business.

In the future, Elvira dreams of seeing her youngest child, who is 16 years old, finish schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon and floaters

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamsuren, 33 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a heavy truck at a mining company since 2012. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. 

Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house. Now he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass in order to further preserve energy at home.

loans.use: to buy hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows and fiberglass to further preserve energy at home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has a rental house business in Makueni town and has been in this business for the past 20 years now. She is 48 years old and a single mother of two children.  She will use this loan amount to buy construction materials for renovating her rental houses. These include paint, iron sheets and ceiling boards. This will enable her to attract more tenants and make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family. This will be her sixth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, having paid back the previous loans successfully. Mary’s future hopes are to be successful in her business and be able to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for renovating her rental houses.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
This is Jelita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jelita wants her business to grow bigger, and she hopes for her family to be always free from any sickness. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida es una mujer de 40 años, casada, tiene dos hijos de diez y otro de seis años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es buena madre, paci4ente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Bolivar’ un área industrial donde existen muchas fábricas en todas las áreas, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura de doce grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Zoraida es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como chofer sindicalizado y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela, toda la familia vive en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas natural. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; pollo frito, hamburguesas, salchipapas (salchichas con papas fritas), etc. este es el cuarto año que viene realizando esta actividad y su negocio es próspero porque tiene muchos clientes. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener ayudantes para llegar a más clientes. Ella desea realizar el mantenimiento del motorizado de su esposo, para que continúe trabajando y ayude con los gastos.
Es por esos motivo que Zoraida solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su minibús para que su esposo trabaje.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 40 years old, married, and has two children who are ten and seven years old. She works selling fast food. She is a good mother, patient, responsible, and hard-working. She operates her business in the ‘villa Bolivar’ area, an industrial zone with many factories of all different types. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperate that stays around 12 degrees Celsius (54 Fahrenheit) all year round. 

Zoraida has brown skin and long black hair. She is of medium stature and her native language is Aymara, but she also speaks Spanish. 

She lives alongside her husband, who is a member of the driver’s union, and her two children who are in school. The whole family lives in a rented house that has potable water, electricity and natural gas. She sells fast food such as fried chicken, hamburgers, salchipapas (hotdogs with French fries), etc. This is the fourth year she has been running her business, and it is profitable because she has a lot of clients. Her dream is to expand her business and hire helpers so she can reach more clients. 

She would like to ensure the maintenance of her husband’s vehicle, so he can continue working and contributing to household expenses. For this reason Zoraida is requesting a loan to repair his minibus, so her husband can work.

loans.use: to ensure the maintenance of her husband’s minibus so he can continue working.

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha, 46 years old, is a taxi driver. He also trades in cattle. He began this business to get income to support his family. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. He hopes to buy his own taxi. His challenge is limited capital to increase the business. 

He is hardworking and thanks the Kiva lenders for the generosity. He hopes to get another loan after this one in order to stabilize his business. In the photograph is Twaha and the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Sumiya

texts.en:
Sumiya, 48, lives with her husband in Kherlen, the most eastern town of Mongolia. Their two children study at university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Sumiya has been teaching high school for 27 years. Her husband transports goods between districts. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik to pay rent for the apartment that her children live in. This year, due to a shortage of dormitory rooms, her children have to rent an apartment during their study period in Ulaanbaatar. 

The apartment owner demands a one-year rental amount and, because  winter is coming to Mongolia, this has become an urgent issue for her children. If she pays the rent, her children will concentrate on their studies without worrying about rent.

loans.use: to pay rent for her children's apartment while they attend university

loans.name: Vichet

texts.en:
Vichet is a 23-year-old credit officer at an institution, and he is also a third-year university student. Being a credit officer, he can earn approximately $8.40 per day to cover his expenses. 

Because of a shortage of finances, he decided to secure a loan to pay his third-year tuition fee. This loan will help him finish the third year successfully. For his dream, Vichet wants to work in a bank with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his third-year tuition fee

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 50s, is divorced with seven children who are grown-ups. She has been running a business of selling juice, water, soda, mandazi, chapati and cakes for ten years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the out-of-stock items in her shop. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to take care of herself and covered household expenses. She saved some in the bank. She will use this loan to increase supply of juice, soda, water, mandazi, chapati and cakes. She dreams of having her shop become big and international standard.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, "Sarafina," which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase supply of juice, soda, water, mandazi, chapati and cakes.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 26 years old. He is married to Velmar and together they have been blessed with one child who is one year old.

Charles has a retail shop which he has run for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000.

Charles has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES 30,000, which he will use to add to his stock of retail products for resale. Such stock includes body oils, body sprays, bathing soaps and hair products among others.

With the anticipated profits, Charles will be able to continually restock his business as he continues to expand.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy stock for his retail cosmetics shop.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Francisco” está integrado por familiares que se ganan la vida vendiendo artesanías, ropa deportiva,  bocinas y sombreros. 

Don Román quien es el representante del grupo es un hombre muy trabajador tiene 65 años de edad, está casado con la señora Teresa desde hace 40 y juntos formaron una familia con nueve hijos aunque actualmente ya ninguno depende de ellos, sino que también han formado su propia familia. Don Román y Doña Teresa son abuelos de 17 niños.

Cuando era joven don Román no tenía un trabajo fijo y decidió iniciar con la venta de limones en la Cuidad de México. En su momento fue un negocio muy bueno pero con el tiempo sus ganancias eran cada vez menos. La pasión que tenia por vender era muy grande así que comenzó a vender ropa deportiva, sombreros y artesanías.

Don Román y los demás integrantes necesitan el crédito para comprar mercancía, pero sobretodo materia prima como hilos, estambres, aujas, etc. para bordar y tener artesanías listas para los meses de noviembre y diciembre cuando tienen sus mejores ventas. Toda la familia trabaja con mucho empeño durante todo el mes de octubre y noviembre porque ya tienen clientes seguros a los que les entregan bufandas, gorros y guantes bordados. Para ellos es un extraordinario negocio porque la temporada de vientos fríos ya está iniciando y la gente compra mucho este tipo de prendas. "Es un patrimonio de nuestros abuelitos, ellos fueron los que nos enseñaron a bordar” comentó don Román. Además de vender a los clientes seguros, la familia también sale a vender a la capital del país. 

Las dificultades a las que se ha enfrentado don Román es que no tiene un espacio determinado para vender y en ocasiones la policía no permite a vendedores ambulantes establecerse en cualquier lugar, por lo que sus sueño es tener un local donde mostrar todas sus prendas bordadas. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Teresa quien invertirá en bocinas y lámparas; Esperanza, en artesanías y Erika, en bocinas.

*La foto fue tomada afuera de la casa del señor Román y los integrantes muestran una bolsa con la ropa bordada que elaboran.
texts.en:
The San Francisco group is made up of families who make a living selling crafts, sportswear, speakers, and hats.

Román who is the representative of the group is a very hard working man who is 65 years old. He has been married to Teresa for 40 years and together they formed a family of nine children but currently none of them are dependents, as they have formed their own families. Román and Teresa have 17 grandchildren.

When he was young Román did not have a steady job and he decided to start by selling lemons in Mexico City. At the time it was a very good business but eventually he was earning less. He has a great passion for sales so he began selling sportswear, hats, and crafts.

Román and the other members need loans in order to buy merchandise, but above all supplies such as yarn, embroidery thread, and knitting needles to have handicrafts ready for the months of November and December when they have their best sales. The entire family works hard during all of October and November because they already have certain customers to deliver scarves, hats, and knitted gloves. It is an extraordinary business for them because the cold winds are already starting and people buy a lot of these types of garments. “It is an inheritance from our grandparents, as they were the ones that taught us to knit,” Román commented. Besides selling to regular customers the family also goes out to sell in the country’s capital.

The difficulty that Román has faced is that he does not have a fixed place to sell and sometimes the police to do not allow the traveling vendors to sell in one place or another, so his dream is to have his own facility where he can show all his knitted garments.

The other members of the group are Teresa who will invest in speakers and lamps, Esperanza in handicrafts and Erika in speakers.

The photograph was taken outside Román’s house and the members are showing a bag with the knitted clothing they make.

loans.use: to buy yarn, embroidery thread, and needles

loans.name: Lovely Sisters Group

texts.en:
Vicenta is the featured borrower of the Lovely Sisters group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They have been friends since they left their hometown the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Vicenta is a 46-year-old married mother of four children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a Loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to support her family in the Philippines to cover their increasing living expenses.

The same case is applied to the other group members; Prciosa is a 40-year-old married mother of two children, and Teresita is a 45-year-old married mother of two children, and they both want to help their families in the Philippines.

Vicenta is the lady standing in the middle, Prciosa is the lady on the left, and Teresita is lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to support her family in the Philippines

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Stephen. He is a progressive, smallholder, mixed-farmer in Kenya. He comes from the luxuriant, white highlands of Nkubu, an area known for maize production and dairy farming. Stephen owns a fertile, two-acre piece of land in this lush region of Kenya. On the land, he keeps dairy cattle and grows maize. He gets a lot of support from his dear wife, Salome. Being a father of four comes with lots of responsibility and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work, so Stephen has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of his family. 

Stephen started farming just after finishing high school; since he never advanced his education and because of the high unemployment rate he ventured into farming, and he has never regretted this because of the profits he has been making. Stephen practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in his village because he is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also doing crop farming. Stephen is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy farming in large scale but one of the challenges he has faced is lack of enough capital. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. 

Through the loan Stephen is confident that his life will be transformed and his dream of providing a secure future for his children will be achieved. Stephen is relieved to know that his life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small scale and aspiring men such as him.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chaman

texts.en: A lady by the name of Chaman will use this loan to develop her business so she can meet her clients' needs and generate more income for her family. This will be her first loan. Chaman devotes herself to sales and has a small café, which she was able to obtain with great effort. She says that at the beginning it was quite hard, but that little by little, her business was able to take off and that her business is now growing. She is requesting this loan to purchase kitchen equipment for her café. She is grateful for the opportunity she will be granted, as the loan will allow her to improve sales and to continue helping her family as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her café.

loans.name: Akilakhon

texts.en:
Akilakhon was born in 1966. She is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her lifetime partner is a driver and they have two children. They live in her house together. Akilakhon is one of the successful business women of her region. For more than 14 years she has been busy with buying and selling blankets. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills helped her to develop her business and in this way improve her living condition. 

She wants to develop her business further but her income is small and she needs to your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy blankets for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy blankets to have more stock for resale

loans.name: Grupo Del Reense Group

texts.es:
"Grupo del Reense" está conformado por mujeres mazahuas muy trabajadoras y amables, al escuchar hablar de KIVA y como funciona, se emocionaron mucho porque personas de otros países las conocerían. Para ellas es muy importante que todos conozcan el nombre de su grupo que está en mazahua, su lengua materna y significa Capulín Grande. Este es un fruto muy conocido en las comunidades del estado de México. El fruto se da en el mes de Julio con el cual mas madres mexicanas preparan dulce o tamales, antojitos mexicanos muy ricos.

Mayte es una de las integrantes y a pesar de tener 21 años, es muy responsable. Vive en unión libre con Juan Manuel quien trabaja como albañil mientras que ella se encarga de su tienda de abarrotes y cuida de su pequeña quien es su mayor motivación para mejorar su calidad de vida. Hace apenas un año y medio que la pequeña tienda abrió pues anteriormente Mayte trabajaba en la capital del país. Sin embargo, cuando supo que esperaba a su niña, decidió regresar a su comunidad, pero quería seguir ayudando a Juan Manuel con los gastos. “Le pedí a mi esposo que me comprara unos dulces para poder venderlos en casa y con las pocas ganancias obtenidas fui comprando más mercancía”. Poco a poco Mayte fue levantando su negocio y ahora necesita un préstamo para comprar más pan, huevo, leche, azúcar, productos enlatados, detergente etc. “Quiero tener un negocio estable donde no falte ningún producto” comenta Mayte después de hablar de las demás tiendas que hay en la misma comunidad y del buen servicio que necesita ofrecer para conservar a sus clientes.

*En la imagen: Mayte viste un suéter de color café, la foto fue tomada debajo del kiosco del municipio donde viven las integrantes.
texts.en:
The "Grupo del Reense" is composed of hardworking and kind Mazahua women. After hearing of Kiva and how it works, they were excited because people from other countries would know of them. For them, it is very important that people know the name of their group, which means Big Capulin (a Mexican cherry) in the Mazahua language. This is a common fruit in the communities of the State of Mexico. This fruit is harvested in the month of July and Mexican mothers use them to prepare sweets or tamales, which are delicious Mexican snacks.

Mayte is one of the members. Even though she is only 21 years old, she is very responsible. She is in a common law relationship with Juan Manuel, who works as a construction worker while she takes care of her grocery store and her young daughter, who is her main motivation to improve her quality of life. The grocery store opened a year and a half ago. Prior to that, Mayte worked in the country's capital. When she knew she was expecting her daughter, she decided to return to her community, but wanted to continue helping Juan Manuel with the household expenses. "I asked my husband to buy me sweets to be able to sell them at home and I began buying more products with the small profits". Little by little, Maybe improved her business and now needs a loan to buy more bread, eggs, milk, sugar, canned products, detergent, etc. "I want to have a stable business that does not lack any products" says Mayte after speaking about the other stores in her community and of the quality service that she needs to keep her customers. 

* Maybe wears a brown sweater in the photo. The photo was taken under the kiosk of the town where the group members live.

loans.use: to buy more bread, eggs, milk, sugar, canned products, detergent, etc.

location.town: Dios Padre, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is single with three children. Two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 30 years. She works seven days a week. Deborah has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy local gin, local brew, crates of beer and soda. She aspires to build more rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent for the shop.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, beer, jerrycans of local brew and spirits.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en: Tohirjon is married and has three non-adult children. Tohirjon’s wife is a housewife. He is a higher educated man. Tohirjon has worked in a school for many years. He is a smart and clever man. Tohirjon is a very kind man and he wants to help his nephew. His nephew studies at the university. He is 17 years old and studies at the first course. He must to pay for his tuition but his parents have no opportunity to do so. Tohirjon is the only one who can help him. Tohirjon is asking for a loan to pay university tuition for his nephew. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for his nephew.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She has a restaurant business and has applied for a loan of 2,800,000 Ugandan Shilling from MCDT- SACCO to buy more food stuffs like bunches of green bananas, beef,  fish, beans and cooking oil. 

Eva generates additional income from charcoal selling and rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality of food stuffs. She aspires to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beans, flour, peas, green banana and beef

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has been blessed with 5 kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwanamisi operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 2 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mwanamisi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
For the last five years Lilian has been selling kerosene for a source of income to support her family and earns a monthly income of KES.12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is married to Leonard and blessed with four school-going children.

She has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of kerosene.

Lilian will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to stabilize and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kerosene

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en: An old woman living in Kampong Speu province, Koem is 60 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family's needs, she grows rice as her single source of income. This is the first time for Koem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family's health and living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a water filter for her home.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Gulnigor

texts.en: Gulnigor began business dealings six years ago in Tajikistan. She started her business by buying and selling children's clothing. Then she changed her business. Now she sells a variety of fabrics in a local market. Gulnigor has been borrowing from IMON for two years. She is an honest woman and has a good credit history. She used her previous loans to improve the business. Gulnigor is going to increase her working capital and in this way maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy fabrics to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Sunshine Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the featured borrower of Sunshine group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon for a better income, to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Rosa is a 39-year-old married mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing living costs in the Philippines.
 
The same case is applied to the other group members; Melinda is a 36-year-old married mother of one child, and Florida is a 42-year-old married mother of two children. They both want to help their families in the Philippines.

Rosa is the first lady on the left, Melinda is the lady standing in the middle, and Florida is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to meet her family's increasing living costs in the Philippines.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Doña Sofía de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales pisques desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora los alimentos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz para los tamales, frijoles, tomates, manteca, etc. y asi seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Sofia is 59 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children. For the last 20 years, her occupation has been making and selling Salvadorean tamales. She has a lot of customers because of the quality with which she makes her products. She is requesting a loan to buy corn for the tamales, beans, tomatoes, butter, etc. to be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tamales, beans, tomatoes, butter, etc.

loans.name: La Tarejera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Tarejera” se encuentra en una comunidad llena de tradiciones mexicanas e indígenas que tienen su origen en la cultura mazahua. En los últimos meses del año es cuando se tienen más celebraciones y las familias se reúnen para compartir. 

Doña Eufemia es una de las integrantes más alegres, siempre esta de muy buen humor y haciendo reír a los demás. Ella tiene 54 años de edad y está casada con el señor Roberto desde hace 40, juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cales ya solo dos dependen de ellos.

Durante más de 15 años, Eufemia se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de cerdos que compra con tan solo unos días de nacidos a los ganaderos más importantes de la comunidad. Los animales, se quedan en casa de Eufemia 4 meses, tiempo en el que alcanzan un tamaño y peso ideales para después venderlos a las personas de su comunidad que se están preparando para tener alguna celebración en familia y usar la carne del animal para preparar algún platillo. Doña Eufemia necesita un préstamo para comprar más cerditos y alimento, el cual es caro y tiene que comprar cada 15 días. Este es precisamente el reto más grande de la actividad, especialmente si hay falta de dinero para invertir. 

Eufemia comenta que aún tiene un gran sueño por cumplir: ver a sus hijos terminar una carrera profesional y es por ello que trabaja día tras día, para que sus hijos sepan que puede contar con ella.

Los integrantes del grupo son: Eva, Jacintay Teresa quienes invertirán en la cría y engorda de cerdos; Beatriz, en plásticos; Edmunda, en borregos y Leticia, en pollos. Todas ellas se conocen desde hace muchos años y están muy agradecidas con KIVA y VisionFund por la oportunidad de continuar con sus actividades.
texts.en:
The group “La Tarejera” is located in a community that abounds with both Mexican and indigenous traditions, whose origins are found in the Mazahua culture. The last months of the year are when the greatest number of celebrations take place, and families get together to share with each other.

Eufemia is one of the most cheerful members. She is always in a good mood and making the others laugh.  She is 54 years old, and has been married to Roberto for the last 40. Together they form a family with seven children, of which only two are still dependent on them. 

For over 15 years now Eufemia has earned her living raising and fattening pigs. She buys them only a few days old from the most important farms in the community. The animals live at Eufemia’s house for 4 months, the time needed to reach the perfect size and weight to sell them to people in the community that are preparing some type of family celebration, and will use the meat from the animal to make a special dish. 

Eufemia needs a loan to buy more piglets and food, which is very expensive and something she has to buy every two weeks. This is precisely the biggest challenge in her business, especially if she is lacking money to invest. 

Eufemia says she still has one big dream to see fulfilled: seeing her children end up in a professional career. This is why she works day after day, so her children know that they can count on her. 

The members of the group are: Eva, Jacintay Teresa, who will invest in raising and fattening pigs; Beatriz, in plastic products; Edmunda, in lambs; and Leticia in chickens. All the members have known each other for many years and are very grateful to KIVA and VisionFund for the opportunity to continue their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and food.

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Hello! Introducing Sammy, a 28-year-old father who is full of energy and a very hard worker. He hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area with good and favorable weather patterns that support farming. He is a father of one child who is under his care from his marriage. Sammy completed his secondary school education thanks to the financial support and effort of his parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit he had for succeeding in life. 

Sammy has been farming for the past ten years, and through mixed farming, he has been able to take care of his family. He loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows 'Motune' (from a person's name). Although Sammy passionately loves farming, he faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why he is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Sammy comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will assist him in harvesting water during the rainy seasons and also to store water for home consumption. 

Harvested water will assist Sammy to irrigate his farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. This loan will turn the life of Sammy around as he will no longer have to walk long distances in search of water, hence saving more time and generating more energy and time to his farm. This loan will help Sammy's wife Stacy too because she will no longer have to walk for hours in search of this precious commodity.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Nikodemus

texts.en:
Nikodemus, 49 years old, is married to Yusina, 46 years old.  They have been blessed with three children, two of whom are married, while the youngest is but three years old. 

In addition to taking care of his children, Nikodemus is also taking care of a nephew who has been living with them since he was a child.  Last year, Nikodemus sent his nephew to continue his studies on another island, and he has the responsibility of paying for the entire venture. 

Having a permanent job as a civil servant does not guarantee that Nikodemus has enough money to cover the expenses of his entire family, including his nephew's education fees. He is therefore requesting a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from TLM to pay those fees and the other needs that his nephew has.

loans.use: to pay the school fees and other needs of his nephew

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru: Элена, 34 года, разведена, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Все дети активно помогают матери. В хозяйстве Элены на сегодняшний день есть: 7 коров, 5 лошадей, 4 теленка и 60 овец, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 0,30 ГА, она выращивает кукурузу.  Ежемесячный доход Элены составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Элена является членом группы "Береке", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для перепродажи. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Элены и ее семьи, и построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Elena is 34 and divorced with four children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years. All of her children are a good help to their mother. Elena currently has seven cows, five horses, four calves and 60 sheep, as well as her own 0.3 hectare piece of land where she grows corn. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. She is a member of the "Bereke" group along with two other people.

With the goal of further developing her business, Elena has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase calves for resale. Profits from the loan will help her to improve her family's quality of life and to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a single mother of five children, four of whom go to school. She has operated a beauty salon for 10 years. She resides in the family house where they have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees , utilities and medication. Betty works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans and is now requesting a loan of 1,400,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair oils, braids and weaves. Betty aspires to start providing bridal services and also to buy better chairs for her salon.

loans.use: To buy treatments, oils, relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Rhuyubake Group

texts.fr: Madame MATISHO est présidente du groupe de credit RHUYUBAKE. A l’âge de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants tous étudiants. Elle est vendeuse des produits alimentaires divers depuis 2004. Elle vient  de solliciter un pret pour acheter 10 sacs de braise, 2 sacs d'haricot et 2 bidons d'huile de palme. Son objectif est de construire une maison et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. C’est dans ce cadre qu’elle remercie HEKIMA pour le travaille qu’elle abat dans le renforcement des activités génératrices de revenus des femmes pauvres.
texts.en:
Ms. Matisho is the president of credit association Rhuyubake. At 35 of age, she is married and a mother of seven children, who all go to school.

She has retailed groceries since 2004. She just requested a loan to purchase ten bags of charcoal, two bags of beans, and two containers of palm oil. Her objective is to build a house and to pay for her children’s education.

This is why she thanks Hekima for its work building up revenue-generating businesses for poor women.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of charcoal, two bags of beans, and two containers of palm oil.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Speu province, Thorn is a 45-year-old mother of nine. Nowadays, she earns income to support her living conditions by selling construction items.

Thorn is requesting her first loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund to help pay for tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in English language. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in English language.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba was born in 1980 and is widowed. She lives with her children in the northern part of Tajikistan. Her children are young. They are 3 and 7 years old years. Nasiba is a business woman. She began business dealings with buying and selling meat. Now, she sells milk and milk products in a store, which is located in a local market. Nasiba has run her business for 10 years and little by little she has developed her business. Nasiba is the only caregiver for her children and that’s why she works hard. She is going to repair her store and in this way she intends to improve business and attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Tajikistani Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, soil, paints etc. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her store

loans.name: Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.fr: Madame ASINA assume la responsabilité de présidente du groupe de crédit TUSONGE MBELE. Agée de 54 ans, mère de 8 enfants est mariée à un enseignant. Elle s’occupe de la vente  de farine de manioc dans un de marché de la ville. Le nouveau crédit sollicité va lui faciliter l'achat de 150kgs de farine afin de faire évoluer son entreprise. Son objectif est de prosperer dans les affaires, au finish, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en:
Ms. Asina is the president of credit association Tusonge Mbele. At 54 of age, she has eight children and is married to a teacher.

She works selling cassava flour at one of the city’s markets. The newly requested loan will allow her to purchase 150 kilos of flour to grow her business. Her objective is to prosper in business.

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima and prays God to bless them.

loans.use: purchase 150 kilos of flour.

loans.name: Bicol Group

texts.en:
Judith is the featured borrower of Bicol Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines. 

Judith is a 47-year-old married mother of four children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing costs in the Philippines. 

Judith is the lady standing in the middle in the photo, Lailani is on the right, and Antonette is on the left.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing costs in the Philippines

loans.name: Umida

texts.en: Umida is married and has 3 children. She is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. Umida began her own business dealing in animal husbandry 4 years ago. She buys cows, feeds them for some months and then sells them in a local market. She requested a loan in the amount of 8,500 Tajikistani Somoni to buy a car, which is necessary to improve her business deals. She awaits your generosity and thanks you for your support in advance.

loans.use: To buy a car for business use

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.fr: Madame NANKAFU est une vendeuse des savons au marché central, activité qu’elle a entreprise grâce au soutien de son mari depuis 2002. Elle est présidente de l'association de crédit AMKA, mère de 8 enfants à l’âge de 36 ans.Elle demande un nouveau pret pour acheter  18 cartons de savon afin d'approvisionner son stock et ainsi prosperer dans les affaires. Malgré, les difficultés de mévente, elle remercie beaucoup HEKIMA et ses partenaires pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes.
texts.en:
Ms. Nankafu sells soap at the central market, a business she started in 2002 thanks to to her husband’s support. At age 36, she presides loan association Amka and is the mother of eight children.

She is requesting a new loan to purchase 18 boxes of soap in order to increase her stock and prosper in business. Despite sales difficulties, she deeply thanks Hekima and its partners for the support they give to women.

loans.use: to buy 18 boxes of soap.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola was born in 1985. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Lola has been busy with growing crops and vegetables for five years. She sells the harvest in a local market. She also earns additional income from animal husbandry. Lola works hard to earn a living. 

Lola must buy wood and coal to keep her house warm in winter. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Somoni with this aim. She really needs your financial support because her children are little and she must keep her house warm. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy wood and coal to keep warm her house in winter season

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy is a hardworking business lady from Tajikistan. She lives there with her husband and daughter. 

Tursunoy has been busy with buying and selling women's clothes for 12 years. She is a very hardworking woman and has a very good attitude towards her customers. The requested loan is very important for this woman to purchase new stocks of clothing to resell to her customers. 

She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy women's clothes to increase her working capital. This loan will help her to improve business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is married and has four children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She has a business selling used clothes at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for 5 years. She works at the market six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a plot of land and also open up another shop for used clothes. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.fr: ZANINGA est membre du groupe de crédit UVUMILVU où elle est présidente à l’âge de 34 ans. Couturière de son état depuis  1999 grâce à l’impulsion de son mari.Elle est mariée à un homme sans emploie et ensemble ils ont 5 enfants scolarisés. Elle vient solliciter un nouveau pret pour acheter 15 tissus et 10 fils dans le but d’agrandir son entreprise et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour son coup de main.
texts.en:
Zaninga belongs to loan association Uvumilvu, which she also presides. She is 34 years old. She has been a seamstress since 1999, thanks to initial capital from her husband. She is married to an unemployed man; together, they have five children who all go to school.

She just requested a new loan to purchase 15 pieces of fabrics and 10 different types of thread. Her goal is to grow her business and pay her children’s school expenses. She thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of fabrics and 10 different types of thread.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a single mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Cissy has a business selling soft drinks at the market and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda, oranges, pineapples, passion fruits and pawpaws for making juice, and sugar. Cissy works in her shop six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. She aspires to own a deep freezer so as to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy soda, oranges, pineapples, passion fruits, pawpaws and sugar

loans.name: Tusimame Imara Group

texts.fr: Madame NSIMIRE M', âgée de 52 ans est veuve, mère de 9 enfants et assume les responsabilités de Présidente du groupe TUSIMAME IMARA. Elle s’occupe de la vente de la farine de manioc et de maïs depuis 1990 grâce à l’impulsion de ses parents. Elle vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui permettra d'acheter 30kgs de farine de manioc et 25kgs de farine de maïs afin d’agrandir son entreprise, épargner et payer les frais scolaires des enfants. Elle remercie IMF HEKIMA pour son coup de main envers la population pauvre.
texts.en:
Ms. Nsimire M' is 52 years old. She is a mother of nine and the president of group Tusimame Imara. She has kept herself busy selling cassava and corn flours since 1990, thanks to her parents’ initial help.

She just requested a loan which will allow her to purchase 30 kilos of cassava flour and 25 kilos of corn flour and grow her business to save money and pay for her children’s school expenses. She thanks IMF Hekima for its support of impoverished folks.

loans.use: to buy 30 kilos of cassava flour and 25 kilos of corn flour.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya, this charming and nice lady, is 32 years old and lives with her family in Vanadzor town of the Lori region. She is the mother of a 12-year-old daughter. 

For four years Sonya has been involved in clothing sales. She takes orders from her customers. As Sonya says, she is very happy to help her family financially with her business income, since her family's needs are a lot. Her daughter attends school, her mother takes care of the household and her two sisters are unemployed. 

Sonya is asking for a loan in order to enlarge the assortment of her clothing for sale.

loans.use: to pay for new assortment of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 55-year-old married woman who is living with her husband (also shown in the photo). 

She has been involved in the business of calendar-making with her husband for many years. They make beautiful calendars for the people of their community. Their designs are much in demand and they have retained many customers. 

In order to increase their sales, Parveen has requested a loan of  45,000 PKR to buy good quality paper, cardboard, dye, and ink. In this way they would be able to cater for more customers consistently. The couple is hopeful to get an increase in their income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy good quality paper, cardboard, dye, and ink.

loans.name: Maa Gajalaxmi Group

texts.en:
The Maa Gaja Laxmi SHG (Self Help Group) was formed in August 2014 by eleven active women entrepreneurs of  the village called Khaerpadar located in Nuapada district, one of the poorest districts of India. The main objective of forming the SHG was to take a loan from the Mahashakti Foundation and develop their small existing businesses for better livelihood of their families. 

Sangita the cheerful lady standing with raised hand in the photo is one of them. She is 22 years old and her family consists of her husband and one small child. Sangita has been running a small bakery factory in her house with the help of her husband for last five years. She produces cakes or breads, muffins, donuts, and other baked goodies in her factory. She has engaged two skilled laborers for the processing and making of bakery items. 

Her husband supplies the products to nearby town and also vendors from ten villages come to her to take the products. Sangita says that, owing to better quality, design, packing and forms of her products, there is a lot of demand from the locality, but due to shortage of stock she was not able to meet their demands. 

She does not like to say “No” to her customers and wants to give better services to them. So she now wants to buy more stock raw materials at a time to save the transportation cost and price hike as well as to increase her production to meet the demands and grab her customers. From the present loan of 16,000 INR, Sangita has planned to purchase raw materials like oil, dough, sugar etc. in bulk to produce the bakery items for a longer period. 

As the present location of the factory is congested and not so suitable, she also wants to construct a separate house in a prominent place of her locality to run the business smoothly. She hopes to save money from the sale proceeds to provide better education facilities to her child and purchase a van for supply of items in the locality.

The other ten members of the group, who are also doing business like mobile repairing shop, tiffin stall, rice haler, milk selling, etc., want to grow their business by taking this loan. All group members feel that from this investment they can be able to develop their living standards.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of oil, dough, sugar, etc., in bulk for more bakery production for better living standards

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en: Ramzana is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been doing a business of cattle sales and purchases for many years. Ramzana fully supports and assists her husband with his work. They currently have one cow and two buffaloes. Ramzana is in her seventh loan cycle. She has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives in Dzoraget village, Lori region with his wife. Albert and his father, for five years already, have rented a garage where they provide auto repair service. Due to their hard work, Albert and his father run their business in an effective way and already have their client base. 

The reason of applying for this loan is the following: Albert needs to construct a dryer for the cars, near his garage. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for dryer construction

loans.name: Mahnaz

texts.en: Mahnaz is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past five years, has been running a business selling cloth. Mahnaz buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000/- PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 24 years old and is married to Jackline.  They are blessed with one child who is one and half years old. 

Lawrence has been in a rental business for the last eight years and earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES.
