He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more building materials to construct another rental house.                                                                                           

Lawrence will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land . He hopes to grow his business and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more building materials to construct another rental house.

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en:
Mounira is a 56-year-old lady who takes care of her old father. She started tailoring from her house twelve years ago to cover the expenses and needs of her father for she is his sole provider.

Today, Mounira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business through buying necessary textiles and tailoring tools to facilitate her work and provide her customers with better and quick services.

Mounira hopes to open her own tailoring shop in the future to increase her income and satisfy her old father's needs in a better way.

loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring tools

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline sells textile materials and has been in the business for one year. She is 28 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with six children. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of textile materials to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful and support her family.

loans.use: To buy more textile materials to sell.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en: Dilshad is a 52-year-old married woman. Five years ago, she decided to support her family by stitching clothes at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Dilshad is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting the daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth. Dilshad hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 36-year-old married woman who deals in the business of selling clothes to provide for her family. She purchases a variety of wedding clothes from the wholesale market at low prices and then sells them to the people of her locality.  

She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Shama  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of clothes in various colors to meet customers’ demands consistently. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothes  in various colors to meet customers’ demands consistently.

loans.name: Munawer

texts.en:
Munawer is 38 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. She has been providing services of flour grinding in her community with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone so she started this business in her home to contribute in the family income. She very well knows the techniques of grinding so she has become famous for providing fine quality flour. She earns enough to support the needs of her family members. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. It would help her to cater to more customers time after time which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine to cater to more customers time after time

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is 41 years of age. She has great skill in hand embroidery and has  experience of two years in this field. It has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her five children. Najma is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health-related expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 44 year old married woman. Her husband is a labourer. She has five children and a total of seven members in her home. 

It was very tough for Shabana to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband and increase their earnings. For this purpose, she started her business of cloth trade eight years ago. She buys cloth of different varieties from the market and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. 

Currently, she applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a wider variety of cloth in different colours and designs. By taking into account the taste and choice of her customers, she expects a boost in her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of cloth in different colours and designs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for six years now. He is 29 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with four children. 

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to improve his business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is 55 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Rubina’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Rubina has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Rubina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for the vehicle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen  is a 51-year-old vigorous married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Nasreen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of five children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time to gain more profits through her embroidery business.

loans.name: Niginamoh

texts.en: Niginamoh is a 38-year-old resident of Khuroson district. She is married and her husband works as an engineer at the hydroelectric power station. They have children of school age. Niginamoh loves her family and tries for the sake of their well-being. She makes a living by engaging in animal husbandry. Niginamoh has already bred cattle for the past eight years. Husband and children help her in it. She enjoys of her business, because she likes domestic animals. Niginamoh now wants to increase the number of livestock. For this she needs a loan. Due to the loan, Niginamoh can increase the profitability of her business and so she hopes for the support.

loans.use: To purchase a few heads of cattle for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her husband and 12-year-old daughter. Her husband is employed in the government sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. Susanna, in addition to her work in a laboratory, is also involved in clothing sales. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years already. Susanna acquires new stock of clothing from the capital city. Due to her hard and nice work, Susanna gets many orders during the month, earning enough money to support her family. 
This loan is important for Susanna to purchase new stock of winter clothing to cover her customers' orders. 
Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of winter clothing supplies to cover current orders of customers.

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en: Fakhra is a 45-year-old, married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago, she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings. She wishes to spend it on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings through her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of gifts such as perfumes, wall hangings, decoration items, etc. to increase her son's earnings.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima, 35 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

She offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Saima  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
En una localidad rodeada por plantaciones de caña la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica al trabajo en el campo. Durante el festejo de Día de Muertos los familiares preparan ofrendas para sus difuntos, celebran misa e iluminan el panteón con las veladoras y colores de las flores,  
 
En este lugar se formó un grupo llamado Las Flores integrado por personas trabajadoras, amables, honradas, la cuales además de tener algunas cualidades en común cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica productiva:

Laura - Venta De Manualidades (Coronas Y Guías)
Claudia -Venta De Manualidades (Bolsas Tejidas)
Irene - Venta De Pollo
Epifania –Venta De Cosmeticos 
Isabel - Calzado Por Catalogo
Amadeo - Servicio De Taxi
Norma - Venta De Comida
Mariana - Calzado Por Catalogo
Adahi - Calzado Por Catalogo

La señora Claudia es madre de 6 hijos y tiene 4  nietos, está casada con el señor Pedro quien se dedica a trabajar en el campo. Desde hace ya 5 años doña Claudia ha apoyado a Pedro con los gastos de la casa, para ello utiliza parte de las ganancias obtenidas de la venta de bolsas tejidas de diferentes modelos, tamaño, color y forma, ella comenta que al principio temía que el negocio no rindiera fruto. Su mejor experiencia fue en una visita de dos meses a uno de sus hijos quien vive en Torreón (ciudad ubicada en el norte del país a 14 horas en auto de la localidad de Claudia) “en esa ocasión sólo llevaba 6 bolsas y no pensé se venderían tan rápido lo mejor es que a los clientes les gustaron y desde entonces cada año llevo bolsas”. Los clientes de torreón ya conocen muy bien el trabajo de Claudia y tiempo antes de su llegada hacen los pedidos de bolsas a través de su hijo. 

Claudia necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de hilo omega de diferentes colores, ganchos y chapitas plásticas, "De acuerdo con los pedidos que tengo debo comenzar a trabajar para cumplirles a los clientes".

*En la imagen: la señora claudia viste de blusa color rosa y falda color lila se encuentra al lado de doña epifania quien viste de rosa y norma quien trae blusa rosa con vivos negros.
texts.en:
In a community surrounded by cane plantations, most of the inhabitants work in the fields. During the celebration of the Day of the Dead, relatives prepare offerings for their departed, celebrate mass, and light the cemetery with small candles and the colors of flowers.

In this place was formed a group called Las Flores, made up of hardworking, kind, and honorable people. Apart from sharing certain qualities, each of these women has a productive economic activity:

Laura - Craft Sales (Crowns and Guide Posts)
Claudia -Craft Sales (Knitted Bags)
Irene - Chicken Sales
Epifania –Cosmetics Sales
Isabel - Footwear Sales by Catalog
Amadeo - Taxi Service
Norma - Food Sales
Mariana - Footwear Sales by Catalog
Adahi - Footwear Sales by Catalog

Claudia is the mother to 6 children and she has 4 grandchildren. She is married to Pedro, who works in the fields. For the past 5 years Claudia has supported Pedro, helping with the household expenses. She uses part of the earnings she makes from selling knitted bags, in different models, sizes, colors, and shapes. She says that at the start she was afraid that the business would not work out. Her best experience was during a two-month visit to one of her children who lives in Torreon (a city in the north of the country, 14 hours by car from Claudia's community). "On that visit I only brought 6 bags and I didn't think that they would sell so fast, the best part is that the clients liked them, and since then I bring bags every year." The clients in Torreon now know Claudia's work very well, and they order bags through her son well before she arrives.

Claudia needs a loan to invest in the purchase of Omega-brand thread of different colors, as well as hooks and plastic caps, "in accordance with the orders I have, I should start work so that I can finish them for the clients."

*In the picture: Claudia is wearing a pink blouse and purple skirt. She is next to Epifania, who is wearing pink, and Norma, who has a pink blouse with black edging.

loans.use: to buy Omega-brand thread of different colors, hooks, and plastic caps

loans.name: María Eduviges

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y su madre, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene visión de negocio, saco sus estudios de bachillerato, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando. 

Ella posee un negocio de bisutería y varios artículos de arreglos florales, negocio en el cual tiene más de 20 años, decidió aprender la elaboración de flores y otros artículos en unos cursos que estaban impartiendo cerca de su comunidad, desde entonces decidió emprender su propio negocio, el cual día con día va en ascenso, al negocio viaja todos los días alrededor de 20 minutos.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar materiales para la elaboración de flores para la temporada, como papel de colores, tintes, alambre, plástico, etc.  ya que la cliente manifiesta que carece de capital de trabajo, y dice que en esta temporada necesita abastecerse con bastante materiales para elaborar las flores, porque estos son los meses que más movimiento tienen la mercadería.  

La señora planea a futuro poner otro negocio, manifiesta que pondrá todo de su parte para poder lograrlo y poder cumplir con su sueño de tener un negocio amplio y que pueda generarle mayores ingresos, y además generar fuentes de empleo para sus vecinos y amigos que quieran trabajar, ya que ella quiere formar su patrimonio para que en un futuro a sus hijos nos les falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives with her life partner and her mother. She is a very hard-working, enterprising, and business-minded woman. She earned her high school diploma and her children are studying. She has a business selling decorative items and various floral arrangements, in which she has more than 20 years of experience. She decided to learn how to make flowers and other items in some courses that were offered near her community. She has since decided to start her own business, which day by day is growing. She travels about 20 minutes to her business every day.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to purchase materials to produce seasonal flowers, such as colored paper, dyes, wire, plastic, etc., since she says that she lacks working capital and that she needs to stock up on enough materials to produce flowers during this season: these are the months when there is more movement of merchandise.

In the future, she plans to start another business and says that she will do everything she can on her part in order to achieve it and fulfill her dream of having a large business that can generate her a higher income, as well as sources of employment for her neighbors and friends who want to work. She wants to form her inheritance so that in the future her children do not lack necessities.

loans.use: to purchase materials to produce seasonal flowers, such as colored paper, dyes, wire, plastic, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of selling cosmetics, bangles, and hair accessories etc. for many years. She buys different items from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore, she started her own business to contribute to the family income. Nasreen has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles and jewelry items in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles and jewelry items in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income.

loans.name: Yhovana

texts.es:
Yhovana es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de diez años y una hija de ocho años, y su negocio es una tienda de barrio.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Villa Fátima’ una zona caracterizada por las paradas de transporte con destino al norte del departamento.
Yhovana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español, su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos estudian en la escuela, toda la familia vive en una casa de ladrillo alquilada y cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio que abrió hace seis meses, debido a que encontró un cuarto cerca de tres colegios y pensó que sería una buena oportunidad de negocio. Su tienda ofrece alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, huevos, leche, refrescos, azúcar, etc. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución, su sueño es tener una tienda grande y vender por mayor, ella desea abastecer su negocio realizando la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad, para surtir la mercadería y tener más clientela.
Es por esos motivos que Yhovana solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio surtiéndola de varios productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Yhovana is a woman of 35. She lives with her partner and has a 10-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter. Her business is a neighborhood store. She is entrepreneurial, independent, a good mother, responsible, and hard-working. She carries out her business in the "Villa Fátima" zone, a zone characterized by transportation stops with destinations in the northern part of the department.

Yhovana has a dark complexion and long black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish. She lives with her partner, who works in construction. Her children go to school. The whole family lives in a rented brick house that has potable water and electricity. 

Her business is a neighborhood store that she opened six months ago because she found a room near three schools and thought that it would be a good business opportunity. Her store offers foods of basic necessity such as bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, sugar, etc. This is her second loan sequence with the institution. Her dream is to have a big store and sell wholesale. She wants to supply her business by buying basic foods in order to stock her merchandise and have more customers.

It is for these reasons that Yhovana  is applying for a loan to stock her neighborhood store with various products of basic necessity.

loans.use: to stock her neighborhood store with various products of basic necessity.

loans.name: Maa Baishnadebi Group

texts.en:
Satyabhama, the lady standing with raised hand in the front row of the photo, is a meticulous, energetic, and convinced woman of 34 years from the village Gadiajor of Balangir district in Odisha, India. She is residing with her husband, three daughters of 14, 8, and 6 years, and one son of 10 years of age, all of whom are continuing their studies in the local Higher Secondary and government primary schools. 

Gadiajor is a remotely located village in a neglected area. Due to the border area of two districts, the reach and focus of the administration and public services is very much less for this village. The people of this area are also deprived of many government facilities and bank services for getting support for developing their standard of living.

The main source of income of Satyabhama is vegetable cultivation and vending and cotton cultivation. She produces different types of vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, cabbage, chile, ladies' fingers (okra), etc., in her farm. She also cultivates cotton, which is a cash crop for this area. From the above two businesses, Satyabhama earns a monthly income of 7000 INR. With this income Satyabhama maintains her six-member family and manages the educational expenses and farming expenses. 

She sadly expressed that, this income is not at all sufficient to manage the above expenses and plan for future development. When Mahashakti started intervention in her village, Satyabhama saw a ray of hope and along with 13 other women of her village formed a Self-Help Group named Maa Baishnadebi and took a loan, with 16,000 INR as her share. 

From this loan, she will purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her vegetable farm and cotton cultivation. She is very positive that this loan must help her for fulfilling her dream of constructing a house and educating her children to lead respectable lives.
 
The other thirteen members of this group are also involved in micro enterprises of their own like general grocery shops, cotton cultivation, milk business and fish vending business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her vegetable farm and cotton cultivation.

loans.name: Elsha

texts.en:
Elsha does livestock farming and has been in the business for 3 years. She is 46 years old and widowed with 10 children.

She plans to use this loan to buy a solar panel, which will enable her to light her house well. She will also buy a cooking stove. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her farming business and live well with her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel and a cooking stove.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen  is 47 years old, married, and a mother of 8 children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of thread, packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to sew more dresses

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 37 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of four children. She recently started a small general store at her home. Her husband is employed as a salesperson, but his salary is not enough to lead his family circle alone. Shakeela is making a great effort to support her family. She is accountable to provide for her family. 

However, she faces a financial problem in the growth of her business. She needs to buy more items to operate her store efficiently. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, chocolates, snacks and grocery items to meet the demands of her customers time after time. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, chocolates, snacks and grocery items to meet the demands of her customers time after time.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra  is 35 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Bushra’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Bushra has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married with four children, three of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. Esther sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for nine years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to buy a van to ease transportation and a plot of land. Esther decided to join MCDT SACCO because of available loans. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida, age 63, is a married lady. The man shown in the photo is her brother-in-law. He has been running a small general store to bear their household expenditures. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, her brother-in-law needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demands. For this reason, Khalida has taken a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. It will help him increase his sales and profits at the same time.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices

loans.name: Katebe Farmers Group

texts.en: Tom is 47 years old and married with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. Tom is a member of Katebe Farmers Group who and practices farming. He grows crops such as coffee, beans, rice, maize and cotton to sell to raise income for his family. Tom has a dream of growing his business. However, he is faced with a challenge of pests and diseases plus floods, which affect his gardens. Tom wants money to buy coffee and beans for selling and fertilizers and manure for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy coffee and beans to sell and fertilizers and manure for his gardens.

loans.name: Avetiq

texts.en:
Avetiq and his beautiful family (in the photo) live in Shahumyan village. 

He is a builder, working in a local village. Avetiq receives different orders from villagers to construct their houses. Due to his qualified work, Avetiq receives many orders during the month, so he is able to sustain his family's growing needs. 

Avetiq has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing his construction service and to pay for the outstanding amount of his car. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Avetiq hopes for the lenders' support and goodwill for his business.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing construction services and to pay for the outstanding amount of his car purchase

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her husband and four children (18,16,14 and 6 years old). Her husband, drives a taxi using his own car. Manana has been involved in a retail business for more than two years. Specifically, she trades clothing supplies from her house. Manana's customers are her friends and neighbors, who have limited access to city stores. To be able to purchase a new stock of winter clothing and fruits (citrus) for her customers, Manana has applied for this loan. She wants to enlarge the assortment of clothing she sells to be prepared for the coming season, and start trading citrus fruits, as the demand for it in this season is quite high.
 
Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of winter clothing and citrus fruits to sell

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
This charming man in the photo is Artush. He lives in Vanadzor town with his only son, Vachagan, who is 26 years old. Besides his work as a driver for a local clinic, Artush also provides transportation services for a fee. As you can see from his photo, he does his work with pleasure and love. 

Artush has applied for this loan to be able to purchase five new tires for his car and get prepared for the winter season. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for five new tires for his car.

loans.name: Gjeline

texts.en:
Currently Gjeline has two cows and a calf and owns also about 25 dynym (a dynym is 1,000 square meters) of agricultural land where she mostly plants shamrock and lucerne for her animals and some seasonal veggies and grains. Her family's income comes from livestock, selling raw milk and baby calves, and a retirement pension of her mother-in-law who lives with them.
  
Gjeline is very grateful to all of her lenders for their previous loan, and now she wants their help again to rebuild a stable before it collapses.

loans.use: to repair a very damaged animal stable; she fears that the stable will collapse soon if she does not repair it

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married with two children. She also takes care of additional family members (her father). She has a business of selling chapati at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour and charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to buy a fridge to start selling soft drinks. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour and charcoal

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is married with two children; both of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells soft drinks at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of soda, oranges, pineapples, passion fruits and pawpaws for making juice, sugar and boxes of mineral water. 

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include power shortages, which make her juice get spoiled. She aspires to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy oranges, passion fruits, boxes of mineral water and crates of soda

loans.name: Hekuran

texts.en:
Hekuran is seeking your financial help again to do things for his little activity, and at the same time, he wanted to thank all the persons who helped him previously. 

His oldest child, his son, is now helping in the activity as well, while the other two children go to school respectively. His wife receives a disability income.

loans.use: to buy items and tools used in his construction activity

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Edwin, a 27-year-old father who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth. Edwin is a father of three lovely children that he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Edwin hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Edwin never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. Edward started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, he has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Edwin practices mixed farming on his farm and through the profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs and give his children a good education because he believes that education is the only “key to success”. 

Edwin is a man who is very enterprising. He is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Edwin wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Edward to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Edwin hopes that through the loan, he will improve his living conditions. Edwin's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, he will be able to assure his children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Edwin is not a selfish man and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why he will employ people to work for him on his horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Katrine

texts.en:
Katrine is 61 and a married mother of four children. The reason why she’s requesting this loan is that her daughter has been scheduled for a surgery; a loan of an amount of 130,000 Albanian Lek has been requested to pay for the surgical procedure. Katrine has been photographed with her daughter, Angjelina. They will very much appreciate your consideration in this matter.
 
Katrine has been pursuing livestock as a means for living; she’s got two dairy cows and a calf at the moment and she sells the raw milk to some nearby dairy farms and also sells baby calves. Katrine and her husband are retirees and receive pensions; in addition to this, one of their children is receiving a disability pension.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's surgical procedure.

loans.name: Klodiana

texts.en: Klodiana has been doing well and wanted to thank all her lenders for their kindness: "The money that they lent to me previously, I used it wisely; I bought used items and resold them. I made some money, yet this activity is just to provide food on the table for your children (19 and 14 are mine), and not saving for rainy days. Thus, I would need lenders help this time again to buy the same thing," said Klodiana.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 39-year-old divorced father of one child. He became employed seven years ago at a power company to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Due to his low salary, Bilal is acquiring an educational loan to pay his child's school tuition fees. This loan is very important to him for it will help him build a better future for his child. Bilal hopes to open his own electrical tools shop in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Yakubu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children (Manasseh, Theophalas and Samson) are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To access a loan to meet expenses like clothing and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Farida is a first-time borrower of the Institution who is applying for 1,500,000 UGX.  Farida is a single mother of two children who she educates and takes care of solely by herself. She is a businesswoman who operates a small retail shop on the outskirts of the city. It is that shop that has enabled her to acquire a small piece of land in the neighborhood where she works. She managed to start constructing a small commercial structure that she would occupy with her family and at the same time, use as her operating premises. She, however, got stuck along the way and now the structure has never been laid a hand on since 2010. The bricks are now being washed away by rains and this bothers her so so much. To have the building put at another stage, she opted to borrow money from UGAOFDE Microfinance Ltd. She would use the loan to buy building materials and pay the builder who is her brother. 

Farida has future hopes of being able to educate her children and finishing the construction of her commercial buliding

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Sokol

texts.en:
This is Sokol, a 33-year-old member of the vulnerable ethnic community of Albania. He is married and has two children, 10 and 8 years old. To make a living, Sokol has been selling used items.
 
“Almost everyone in my community pursues the activity of buying/reselling used items. It’s been going good for most of them who have been practicing this. Albania is a poor country with most of the people not affording brand and new clothes, as such people come to our market to buy used items and if needed, they repair them. It comes cheaper than buying new ones", said Sokol. 

Sokol needs your financial help to buy used items to resell. 
 
Kindly note that Sokol has been photographed inside his home, due to the fact that at that moment, he did not have items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on second-hand clothing and other items to resell

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is 59 and a divorced mother of two who lives in the city of Korca. Her profession is hairdresser and she owns her own salon, where she’s been photographed.  She has also rented out the first floor of her home. Thus, she makes an income from her hairdressing profession and from the rent.

Vera has been feeling sick for some time and she needs to pay a visit to a medical specialist. “I have had consistent headaches and dizziness lately. I have no idea where these symptoms come from. I have already gone to some doctors here in the city, and I’ve gotten different diagnoses and I want to go to a better head specialist this time. I hope that lenders will understand the importance of my matter and lend to me. I will pay them back on time, that is for sure,” Vera stated.

loans.use: to pay for a medical visit

loans.name: Josys Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the featured borrower of Josys group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their Philippine hometown to come and work in Lebanon. Here they can earn a better income to support their loved ones back in the Philippines.

Josephine is a 49-year-old divorced mother of one child who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kid and to improve her family's living conditions. She is acquiring this loan to support her family's increasing costs in the Philippines. 

Josephine is the lady standing in the middle. The other group members are Roselle, the lady on the right in the photo, and Marina, on the left.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing costs in the Philippines

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife and two children (ages nine and three years old).
 
For seven years, Suren has been running a general store where he trades different products (souvenirs, toys, perfume, and household goods). He is very nice and pleasant with the customers of the store, so the store is very much in demand among local people in the town. The assortment of goods in his store is big so people prefer to shop there. 

He has now applied for this loan to purchase new stock of souvenirs, toys, perfume, household goods and other accessories for the store.  His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for souvenirs, toys, perfume, household goods and other accessories for his store

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia lives in Kampala, Uganda, and is married with one child. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent for her business and house. 

Sylivia operates a grocery shop at the market and she sells retail. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for 3 years. Her major challenges include the changing prices of her products and transportation. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy biscuits, soap, cooking oil, sodas, soft drinks and other snacks. 

Her goal is to buy a plot of land and to build permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy biscuts, soap, snacks, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 28 years old. She is married with one child who is 2 years old and not yet in school. She sells construction materials and has been running this business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cement and iron sheets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more cement and iron sheets for sale.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
This is Valentina with her apron on - when she was photographed she had just finished making her pie with its tomato and onion filling. When ladies in this region cook, they make sure to have their apron on!  Kindly note that her region is known for the best pastries, especially pies with homemade phyllo pastry. 

Valentina is a villager and she says she has always enjoyed life in the village. She has three children who are all now grown-ups. To make a living, she has rented out the agricultural land she owns and she receives a monthly income from it, in addition to her and her husband’s pension.
 
Valentina needs your help to repair the roofing of her house before the snow starts for good. It snows a lot in their region and if roofs are not in good shape, they can easily sink in.

loans.use: to repair the roofing of her little house before the snow starts and the roof sinks in

loans.name: Mamman

texts.en: Mamman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mamman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mamman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Mamman expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like clothing and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Elizabeth joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Tabitha, Safiya and Samaila. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Elizabeth would have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Elizabeth can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Elizabeth spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to provide food and clothing for her family, hoping to ensure eventually that other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To access a loan to meet expenses like food and clothing, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Haruna, Manaseh and Eli. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Maryamu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to provide food and clothing for her family, eventually hoping to ensure that other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tomor

texts.en:
This is Tomor, a 39-year-old villager who is seeking your financial help to buy a dairy cow. Tomor is a father of three school-age children; the oldest is 16 and the youngest is 8.  He cares for livestock to earn an income for his family. He sells raw milk and baby calves to the local people. In addition, he works with a construction firm from which he earns an income as well. 

The village where Tomor lives is known for the largest amount of produce in the region of beans, potatoes, onions, corn and wheat. Villagers prefer to have cows more than other animals because they are easy to manage and  they produce more milk compared to sheep. Goats are not as easy to manage, according to Tomor.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 42 years old. She is married with one child who is two years old and does not yet go to school. She sells construction materials and has been doing business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cement, nails and iron sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more cement, nails and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 47 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 15. All of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been working in this business for three years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and rice for sale

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Guatemala es reconocido por su gente trabajadora con el deseo de superación en la vida que toma las cosas como un reto en la vida para poder llegar a realizar grandes logros es el caso de Roberto que se a tenido que ingeniar en como tener un ingreso económico por su familia, de 45 años de edad casado y tiene 2 hijos por la cual el realiza actividades artesanales de mostacias para dar estudio a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales.

El trabajo que el realiza en su comunidad donde el vive es la venta y producción de productos artesanales de mostacias ya que genera una ganancia económica para el sustento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y la de el. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad apoyando a las personas que requieren de sus servicios pues el lo hace para tener un ingreso extra del trabajo que realiza.

El uso respectivo que el dará al préstamo que el está realizando es para la compra de productos artesanales de mostacias para luego venderlas en su comunidad y en todos sus alrededores, las metas de el en la vida es la construcción de su casa para que el y su familia tengan una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Guatemala is known for its hard-working people who, with a desire to get ahead, take on the challenges of life to reach their goals.  This is the case of Roberto who has had to figure out a way to earn an income for his family.  He is 45 years old, married and has two children.  He makes and sells crow bead crafts in order to give his children an education so they can become professionals.

He works in the community where he lives and makes and produces artisan crow bead crafts.  This generates an income for him to support the family and improve their living conditions.  The other job he has is working as a day laborer in the community helping people who require his services.  This is a way to earn extra income.

The loan will be used to buy crow bead crafts to sell in his community and neighboring areas.  His goal is to build a house sometime in the near future so the family will have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy crow bead crafts.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu lives in Vanadzor town. She has been in the trade business for 11 years already, so is very skilled and has a number of loyal customers. From a rented store in the center of Vanadzor town, Arzu sells different sorts of women's clothing. She is a very nice person, so customers prefer to shop from her store with great pleasure. 

As the winter season is on its way, and people  demand warm clothing, Arzu currently has a lot of orders. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a new assortment of women's clothing for the winter season and to meet customer demand. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new assortment of women's  clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Suela

texts.en:
Suela is a member of the vulnerable ethnic community of Albania. She is seeking your financial help to buy seasonal ornaments and resell them.

Suela is 38 years old and has two children, 16 and 14, and both go to school. While Suela sells things in the streets, her husband works in a nearby bakery and also with the city as a janitor. “We try to do any type of work we find. We never say no, yet we still remain poor. Some members of our community are doing much better, because they owned something from before or had blacksmith skills that have been so much in need since the collapse,“ said Suela.

loans.use: to buy seasonal ornaments to resell

loans.name: Familia S. C. Group

texts.es:
Gabriela es muy alegre, tiene 29 años de edad y vive en unión libre con Rodolfo, la pareja tiene dos niños pequeños que aún no van a la escuela.

Mientras Rodolfo trabaja en la obra como albañil, Gaby (como es conocida) vende productos de plástico para el hogar como cucharas, fibras, pinzas, lazos, jícaras etc. Debido a que aún no cuenta con un lugar estable, algunos días de la semana sale a caminar en las plazas para ofrecer sus productos. Tampoco tiene días definidos para salir, pero sábados y domingos son muy buenos para obtener mejores ganancias. Ya son siete años en los que Gaby ha salido por las calles para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. “Iniciar mi negocio fue iniciativa propia porque con lo que gana Rodolfo muchas veces no podemos cubrir todos los gastos del hogar”.

Gaby está muy contenta con su negocio porque le encanta tener contacto con las personas, gracias a su negocio ha hecho muy buenas amistades. Cuando era soltera nunca imaginó llegar a tener un negocio o vender en las calles “pero cuando ya tenemos hijos somos capaces de todo para darles lo mejor”. Gaby obtuvo mucho apoyo de sus familiares que también son comerciantes, ellos le recomendaron dónde comprar la mercancía a mejor precio y cómo seguir mejorando en la actividad. Gaby necesita su préstamo para poder comprar más productos pues los últimos meses del año son son fechas de buenas ventas. 

No solo para Gaby sino también para los demás integrantes el préstamo será de gran ayuda en sus negocios: Leobardo y José Leobardo invertirán en manteles de plástico para mesas y Mario invertirá en artículos domésticos.

*En la imagen: los integrantes del grupo se encuentran en la plaza del municipio donde viven y detrás de ellos se puede apreciar la iglesia católica.
texts.en:
Gabriela is very cheerful.  She is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband, Rodolfo.  They have two small children who are not old enough to attend school yet.

While Rodolfo works as a bricklayer, Gaby (as she is known) sells plastic products from home such as spoons, fibers, clips, bows, bowls, etc.  Since she does not have a stable sales location some days of the week she goes out to the town square to sell her products.  The days are not fixed but Saturdays and Sundays are good days to earn more profit.  Gaby has been in this line of work for seven years in an effort to help her husband cover household expenses.  "I started the business on my own initiative because many times we were unable to cover all the expenses with Rodolfo's earnings.".

Gaby is very happy with her business because she loves being in contact with people.  Through her work she has made very good friends.  When she was single she never imagined having a business or selling in the streets "but when we have children we are capable of anything to give them the best we can".  Gaby had much support from her family who are also merchants.  They gave her recommendations about where to buy merchandise at the best price and how to develop her business.  Now she needs a loan to buy more products for the final months of the years which are when sales are high.

The loan will be of great help not only to Gaby but all the members of the group.  Leobardo and José Leobardo will invest in plastic tablecloths and Mario will invest in home products.

*In the photo the members of the group are in the municipal square where they live and behind them is the catholic church.

loans.use: To buy plastic products such as spoons, fibres, clips, bows, bowls, etc.

location.town: San Pedro Chico, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Los Ciruelos De Tultenango Group

texts.es:
“Ciruelos de Tultenango” es un grupo de préstamo que se encuentra en una comunidad donde los habitantes se dedican principalmente al comercio y a la cría de animales. 

Los integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son: Guadalupe invierte en flores de pollo; Clara, en verduras; Antonio, Brisa, Rocío y María de Lourdes, en ropa; Félix, en su taxi y Maribel y Maricela, en pollos y guajolotes.

Guadalupe o Lupita, como le dicen de cariño, es una persona muy alegre, tiene 22 años y es mamá soltera de un bebé de solo dos meses. Por el momento vive en casa de su madre, pero uno de sus sueños es tener una casa propia donde pueda ver crecer a su niño.

Hace seis meses Lupita escuchó hablar de VisionFund y pidió un préstamo que invirtió en pollos y alimento para dedicarse a la cía de estos animales. Para aprovechar la celebración del Día de Muertos quiere comprar flores con un nuevo préstamo pues es una fecha en que las personas acostumbran a poner ofrendas, altares y llevar flores a los panteones, pues según la creencia, las almas de los difuntos llegan a disfrutar por una noche al año los alimentos que más les gustaba en vida y que sus familiares colocan en las ofrendas. “Quise iniciar con la venta de flores porque hace un año yo quería comprar flores, pero no encontré las que quería, ya se habían terminado y no pude llevar al panteón". Lupita espera tener buenas ventas y reinvertir las ganancias en los pollos pues quiere hacer crecer su gallinero. 

*La foto fue tomada en la casa de Brisa después de la firma de su contrato, Lupita es la primera a mano izquierda viste suéter café y tenis blancos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Ciruelos de Tultenango" is located in a community where the population works mainly in commerce and livestock farming.  The members of the group are: Guadalupe who invests in flowers and chickens; Clara in vegetables; Antonio, Brisa, Rocío and María de Lourdes in clothing; Félilx has a taxi service; and Maribel and Maricela invest in chickens and turkeys.

Guadalupe or Lupita, as is her nickname, is a very cheerful person.  She is 22 and a single mother of a two-month old baby.  For now she lives with her mother but she dreams of having her own house to raise her son.

Six months ago Lupita heard about VisionFund and she requested a loan to buy chickens and feed to start raising them.  To take advantage of the celebration of the Day of the Dead she wants to buy flowers with a new loan.  On that day people usually take flowers and set up altars at the cemetery because of the belief that the dead enjoy one night a year feasting on the foods they enjoyed in life with their families.  "I wanted to start selling flowers because a year ago I wanted some and could not find any because they were sold out so I was unable to take any to the cemetery".  Lupita hopes to reach a good sales volume and reinvest her earnings in her chicken business.

*The photo was taken at Brisa's house after signing the contract.  Lupita is the first one on the left in a brown sweater and white tennis shoes.

loans.use: To buy flowers and chickens.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Cristina vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, harina de arroz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, etc.  para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina is 50 years old. She has been preparing and selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) for eight years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. Cristina lives in her own home along with her parents.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn, rice flour, cheese, pork skins, beans, and other ingredients so that she can continue preparing "pupusas". As a result, she can earn more income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice flour, cheese, pork skins, beans, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school expenses and buy a computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cover medical expenses and purchase medicines.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida como cocinera en un restaurante de playa, actividad que tiene mucho tiempo de realizar, además su hijo la apoya con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años y viven con ella sus 3 hijos de 20, 12 y 10 años de edad, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder darles un lugar seguro donde vivir a sus hijos a pesar de ser madre soltera. La vivienda de Ana es muy humilde y tiene muchas cosas que necesita reparar pero principalmente el techo ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, además desea construir un pasamanos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, madera, clavos, cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para cambiar el techo y construir un pasamanos en su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana, 38 years old, is a hard working woman who earns a living as a cook in a beach restaurant which takes a lot of her time.  She lives with her 3 sons of 20, 12, and 10 years of age in a house she's owned for the last 3 years.  One of her sons helps with the home expenses and she's very happy to provide them with a safe place to live, even though she's a single mother. Ana's house is very humble and many things need repairing, specially the ceiling which is in bad condition. Additionally, she wishes to build a handrail to improve the living conditions of her family.  For this purpose she's requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: ceiling sheets, wood, nails, cement, sand, gravel, and brick to replace the ceiling and build the handrail in her home.

loans.use: invest in: ceiling sheets, wood, nails, cement, sand, gravel, and brick to replace the ceiling and build the handrail in her home.

loans.name: Neliberta

texts.es:
Doña Neliberta vive en una comunidad mazahua, ella está orgullosa de pertenecer a este lugar pues las personas son muy amables y se apoyan unos a otros. Doña Neliberta no es la excepción, además es muy trabajadora y en sus hijos ha encontrado la inspiración para seguir trabajando: tiene seis y tres de ellos aún estudian. 

Hace tres años Nelibertra decidió iniciar con la cría y engorda de becerros y cerdos. "Afortunadamente cinco de mis hijos decidieron estudiar, pero los gastos estaban aumentando mucho por eso decidí hacer algo" comento Doña Neliberta. Los animales crecen muy rápido y en cuestión de 4 o 6 meses ella puede ver sus ganancias, aunque el precio del alimento es elevado. Neliberta tiene muy buenos clientes y le agrada la actividad que le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijos. Por supuesto, también habla con orgullo de sus hijos, uno se casó y formó su familia, dos más trabajan en dependencias del gobierno, dos estudian la universidad (nutrición y derecho respectivamente) mientras que el más pequeño está en la primaria. 

Neliberta está muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA porque con su préstamo podrá comprar alimento y más cerdos, además porque el tiempo que lleva solicitando préstamo ha podido invertir para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Neliberta lives in a mazahua community. She's very proud of being from this community because people are very nice and help each other out. Mrs. Neliberta is no exception and she's very hardworking.  She has six children, three of them still in school, and in them she has found inspiration to keep working. 

Three years ago Neliberta decided to start with the breeding and feeding of calves and pigs. "Fortunately five of my children decided to study but the expenses were increasing so I decided to do something about it", said Neliberta.  The animals grow quickly and within 4-6 months she can start making profits although the feed is very expensive. Neliberta has very good clients and likes the activity that has allowed her to support her children.  Of course, she also speaks very proudly of her children.  One of them is already married and has a family. Two of them work for governmental agencies, and two others are studying, nutrition and law respectively. The youngest one is still in middle school. 

Neliberta Is very happy and grateful to VisionFund and KIVA because with this loan she'll buy feed and more pigs and because with the previous loans she's been able to invest in improving the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: buy pigs and feed.

location.town: San Isidro Boxipe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Irving Josue

texts.es:
Irving es un joven muy emprendedor y amable, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en La Tinguiña junto a su familia. Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Administración y para poder pagar su carrera y apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar trabaja como chofer. Cada día Irving sale muy motivado de su casa y se esfuerza al máximo porque piensa que cada día puede ser mejor que el anterior. Su madre es el principal motor que tiene en su vida y es por ella que quiere convertirse en un gran profesional para que pueda brindarle un futuro mejor.
Irving está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá cubrir algunos gastos para mejoramiento de su hogar como pintarrajear y reforzar las paredes de su casa y sí su mamá se sentirá más cómoda y con esta tranquilidad él continuará luchando para poder sacar adelante a sus seres queridos y más adelante pueda construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Irving is a very enterprising and friendly young man. He is 20 years old and lives in La Tinguiña with his family. Irving is currently studying business administration and, in order to pay for his degree and support his mother with household costs, he works as a driver. Every day Irving leaves his house feeling very motivated and tries his best because he believes that every day can be better than the last. Irving's mother is his principal motivation and he wants to become a great professional so that he can provide her with a better future. 

Irving is grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they give will cover some expenses for making improvements to his home, such as strengthening and daubing the walls of his home. His mother will then be more comfortable then and, knowing this, Irving will continue fighting to help his loved ones to get ahead and, in the future, build a house using stronger materials.

loans.use: to strengthen and daub the walls of his house.

loans.name: Dandy

texts.es: Dandy de 42 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 11 meses de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 2 años. Ella se gana la vida con la venta de platillos típicos en su vivienda, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con esta fuente de ingresos económicos. Dandy desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda, ya que su vivienda está hecha de lámina, lo que está provocando que el agua se filtre, es por ello que desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en: Dandy is 42 years old lives with her ​​ partner and young son, who is 11 months old. She has been living in a house that she owns for two years . Dandy makes a living selling typical meals in her home. She has been doing this work for a long time and so she has a good customer base that is always looking for her products. As a result Dandy is very happy to be able to count on this source of income . Dandy wants to build a retaining wall in her house as it is made with metal sheeting, which is causing water to leak in. Dandy is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a retaining wall in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron in order to build a retaining wall in her house.

loans.name: Glendy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glendy, mantiene la continuidad de la venta de pan, pues con el financiamiento anterior ha tenido la materia prima para elaborar la venta, ya ofrece antojitos, golosinas y refrescos a sus clientes, su situación económica ha mejorado y las circunstancias familiares están cambiando positivamente.
Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar más capital para comprar latas, harinas, levadura, manteca, azúcar, aceite, etc., equipara mejor el negocio, tendrá materiales para elaborar la venta y seguir teniendo ingresos para subsistir.
texts.en:
Glendy maintains the continuity of her bread sales because thanks to the previous loan she's had the raw materials for its elaboration. Now, she also offers snacks, candy, and sodas to her clients. Her economic situation has improved and her family circumstances have also been changing for the better. 
She needs to request another loan to buy cans, flour, yeast, butter, sugar, oil, etc. thus better stocking her shop as she will have the materials for the making and selling her food items and have an income to rely on.

loans.use: buy cans, flour, yeast, butter, sugar, oil, etc. thus better stocking her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting and nails to replace the roof of her home and patio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: sheets, wood, nails, cement, sand, gravel, and brick to build the handrail and expand the pathway to her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a second-time borrower of the Institution applying for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX). She is a married woman of six children that she takes care of with the help of her husband. Mary operates a small retail shop in the outskirts of the city and it is this shop that has always helped her be able to contribute some percentage towards paying her children’s school fees. The shop has a lot of customers compared to its stock. She applied for the loan to use it to boost her working capital that shall in the end help her to be able to serve the biggest percentage of her customers and also make her shop a one-stop shopping centre. Expanding her business is her biggest ambition.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, cement slab, and a toilet to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Juan Saul

texts.es: Juan de 36 años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para llevar el sustento a su hogar, por medio de su trabajo como distribuidor de bebidas actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que gustan de sus productos. Él habita junto a sus padres en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años por lo que se siente feliz de contar con un lugar donde vivir. Juan desea reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra en mal estado, además desea comprar una puerta para un cuarto de la misma, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos, alambre, y una puerta para un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan is 36 years old. He is a man who works hard every day to support his home with his work as a beverage distributor. He has done this work for 10 years and has a lot of customers who like his products. He has lived with his parents in his own house for 15 years and he is happy to have a place to live. Juan wants to repair the roof on his house since it is in poor condition. He also wants to buy a door for a room. That is why he is asking for a loan from  FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, nails, wire and a door for a room in his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, nails, wire, and a door for a room in his house.

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.es:
María, invirtió el préstamo anterior en materia prima para la venta meriendas, lo que le permite tener mejores ingresos, dar a su familia un estilo de vida más digno y cancelar sus deudas.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar aceite, verduras, condimentos, maíz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros productos para seguir elaborando las meriendas y tener siempre clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
María invested the previous loan in ingredients for selling meals. This allows her to have better income, give her family a more decent life and pay off her debts. 

She is asking for a loan again to buy oil, vegetables, seasonings, corn, beans, oil, and more products to keep making meals and always have satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, vegetables, condiments, corn, beans, oil, and other products to keep making her meals.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman. Her husband works in the Lebanese army, and she has worked as a female hairdresser since 2006. She has two children, and they are both attending school. 

Currently, Zeinab is eager to improve her business and this is why she is very excited to receive the youth loan which she is applying for from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l as she badly needs to acquire new hairdressing supplies to provide her customers with satisfying services. 

In the future, Zeinab plans to receive more Kiva loans, as she is pretty sure that it will lead her to higher levels in her career.

loans.use: to acquire new hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret, 45 years old, and married with four children. She earns her living by selling vegetables in the local market. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development has helped her fully exploit her entrepreneurial skills. 

She is borrowing a loan to expand the business by buying more stock of potatoes, cabbages and peas. She believes this will further boost her profits, and will put her in a position to sell more to her customers.

Margaret is happy for Kiva, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cabbages, peas and potatoes.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Zipporah, 28 years old, works hard to support her family. She buys vegetables such as tomatoes and onions from the local farmers and supplies them to the city market. 

Zipporah is borrowing a loan to add stock to her vegetable business, which she has been operating for the last two years. She hopes to sell more. This will lead to more profits. She hopes that her business will go a long way in helping her support her family.

Zipporah is happy with Kiva, and the support of their lenders.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables, such as onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 21-year-old Lebanese woman. She got married at a young age, and today she is the mother of a beautiful child. She started her career at a youthful age, since she had to save money and be able to live suitably. Three years ago, she became a talented hairdresser working at her domicile and providing her clientele with fashionable and charming designs, haircuts, etc… 

At present, she seeks to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy hairdressing supplies. 

In the future, she plans to get more Kiva loans, as she desires to open a beauty salon and equip it with modern tools.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Kuuga Na Gwika Women Group

texts.en:
Kuuga na Gwika Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 to get training on how to manage the enterprises.
The group has been able to embrace the training, and the members are now able to keep clear and correct records for their enterprises. 

The person on the left hand side in the photograph is Tabitha, married and blessed with two children. She is a vegetable farmer. She is borrowing a loan to buy manure. This will improve crop yield, helping her to supply more vegetables to the market. She hopes for increased income, hence to be in a position to cater for her children's school fees.

Tabitha is so happy about the financial support.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman who has four children attending school. In 2009, she started to work from her house in producing food. 

With her requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase tools and supplies such as jars, containers, pots and some provisions needed to continue producing a good quantity of products.
